verses.ln1: That I may go to the altar of God, even to the God of my joy and gladness;
verses.ln2: and on the harp will I give thanks to you, O God, my God.

verses.ln1: Why are you so full of heaviness, O my soul?
verses.ln2: and why are you so disquieted within me?

verses.ln1: O put your trust in God,
verses.ln2: for I will yet give him thanks, who is the help of my countenance, and my God.

verses.ln1: We have heard with our ears, O God, our fathers have told us
verses.ln2: what you did in the days of old:

verses.ln1: How you drove out the nations with your hand, and planted our fathers in the land;
verses.ln2: how you destroyed the nations and cast them out.

verses.ln1: For they did not possess the land by their own sword,
verses.ln2: neither was it their own arm that helped them,

verses.ln1: But by your right hand, and your arm, and the light of your countenance,
verses.ln2: because you favored them.

verses.ln1: You are my King, O God;
verses.ln2: you send help to Jacob.

verses.ln1: Through you we will overthrow our enemies,
verses.ln2: and in your Name will we tread down those who rise up against us.

verses.ln1: For I will not trust in my bow;
verses.ln2: it is not my sword that shall help me;

verses.ln1: But you save us from our enemies
verses.ln2: and put to shame those who hate us.

verses.ln1: We make our boast in God all day long
verses.ln2: and will praise your Name for ever.

verses.ln1: But now you have cast us off and put us to shame,
verses.ln2: and you do not go forth with our armies.

verses.ln1: You make us turn our backs upon our enemies,
verses.ln2: so that those who hate us plunder our goods.

verses.ln1: You let us be eaten up like sheep
verses.ln2: and have scattered us among the nations.

verses.ln1: You sell your people for nothing
verses.ln2: and take no money for them.

verses.ln1: You make us the reproach of our neighbors,
verses.ln2: to be laughed to scorn, and held in derision by those who are round about us.

verses.ln1: You make us a byword among the nations,
verses.ln2: so that the peoples shake their heads at us.

verses.ln1: My disgrace is daily before me,
verses.ln2: and the shame of my face has covered me,

verses.ln1: Because of the voice of the slanderer and blasphemer,
verses.ln2: because of the enemy and avenger.

verses.ln1: And though all this has come upon us, yet we do not forget you,
verses.ln2: nor have we been unfaithful to your covenant.

verses.ln1: Our heart has not turned back,
verses.ln2: nor have our steps departed from your way,

verses.ln1: Though you have crushed us in the haunt of jackals,
verses.ln2: and covered us with the shadow of death.

verses.ln1: If we have forgotten the Name of our God, and held up our hands to any strange god,
verses.ln2: shall not God search it out? For he knows the very secrets of the heart.

verses.ln1: For your sake we are killed all the day long,
verses.ln2: and are counted as sheep appointed to be slain.

verses.ln1: Rise up, O Lord! Why are you sleeping?
verses.ln2: Awake, and cast us not away for ever.

verses.ln1: Why do you hide your face
verses.ln2: and forget our misery and trouble?

verses.ln1: For our soul is brought low, even to the dust;
verses.ln2: our belly cleaves to the ground.

verses.ln1: Arise, O Lord, and help us,
verses.ln2: and deliver us for your mercy’s sake.

verses.ln1: My heart overflows with a noble song;
verses.ln2: I will sing my words to the King; my tongue is the pen of a ready writer.

verses.ln1: You are fairer than the children of men;
verses.ln2: full of grace are your lips, because God has blessed you for ever.

verses.ln1: Gird your sword upon your thigh, most mighty one,
verses.ln2: according to your honor and majesty.

verses.ln1: In your majesty be victorious; ride out for the sake of truth, to bear witness to righteousness,
verses.ln2: and your right hand shall show you marvelous things.

verses.ln1: Your arrows are very sharp in the heart of the King’s enemies,
verses.ln2: and the peoples shall be subdued under you.

verses.ln1: Your throne, O God, endures for ever;
verses.ln2: the scepter of your kingdom is a righteous scepter.

verses.ln1: You have loved righteousness and hated iniquity;
verses.ln2: therefore God, your God, has anointed you with the oil of gladness above your fellows.

verses.ln1: All your garments smell of myrrh, aloes, and cassia;
verses.ln2: out of the ivory palaces, stringed instruments have made you glad.

verses.ln1: Kings’ daughters are among your honorable women;
verses.ln2: at your right hand stands the queen in a vesture of gold, wrought with many colors.

verses.ln1: Hearken, O daughter, and consider; incline your ear;
verses.ln2: forget your own people, and your father’s house.

verses.ln1: So shall the King have pleasure in your beauty;
verses.ln2: since he is your Lord, honor him.

verses.ln1: And the daughter of Tyre shall bring you gifts;
verses.ln2: the rich also among the peoples shall seek your favor.

verses.ln1: The King’s daughter is all glorious within the palace;
verses.ln2: her clothing is of wrought gold.

verses.ln1: She shall be brought to the king in embroidered raiment;
verses.ln2: the virgins who are her companions shall bring her to you.

verses.ln1: With joy and gladness shall they bring her,
verses.ln2: and shall enter into the King’s palace.

verses.ln1: Instead of your fathers, you shall have sons,
verses.ln2: whom you shall make princes in all the land.

verses.ln1: I will make your Name to be remembered from one generation to another;
verses.ln2: therefore the peoples shall praise you, world without end.

verses.ln1: God is our refuge and strength,
verses.ln2: a very present help in trouble.

verses.ln1: Therefore we will not fear, though the earth be moved,
verses.ln2: and though the hills be carried into the midst of the sea;

verses.ln1: Though its waters rage and swell,
verses.ln2: and though the mountains shake at its tempest.

verses.ln1: There is a river whose streams make glad the city of God,
verses.ln2: the holy dwelling place of the Most High.

verses.ln1: God is in the midst of her; therefore she shall not be moved.
verses.ln2: God shall help her at the break of day.

verses.ln1: The nations are in an uproar, and the kingdoms are moved,
verses.ln2: but God has lifted his voice, and the earth shall melt away.

verses.ln1: The Lord of hosts is with us;
verses.ln2: the God of Jacob is our refuge.

verses.ln1: O come and behold the works of the Lord,
verses.ln2: what devastations he has brought upon the earth.

verses.ln1: He makes wars to cease in all the world;
verses.ln2: he breaks the bow, and shatters the spear, and burns the chariots in the fire.

verses.ln1: “Be still then and know that I am God;
verses.ln2: I will be exalted among the nations, and I will be exalted in the earth.”

verses.ln1: The Lord of hosts is with us;
verses.ln2: the God of Jacob is our refuge.

verses.ln1: O clap your hands together, all you peoples;
verses.ln2: O cry aloud unto God with shouts of joy.

verses.ln1: For the Lord Most High is to be feared;
verses.ln2: he is the great King over all the earth.

verses.ln1: He shall subdue the peoples under us,
verses.ln2: and the nations under our feet.

verses.ln1: He shall choose our inheritance for us,
verses.ln2: the pride of Jacob whom he loved.

verses.ln1: God has gone up with a shout of triumph,
verses.ln2: the Lord with the sound of the trumpet.

verses.ln1: O sing praises, sing praises unto our God;
verses.ln2: O sing praises, sing praises unto our King.

verses.ln1: For God is the King of all the earth;
verses.ln2: think upon his mighty acts and praise him with a song.

verses.ln1: God reigns over the nations;
verses.ln2: God sits on his holy throne.

verses.ln1: The princes of the peoples are gathered with the people of the God of Abraham;
verses.ln2: for the mighty upon earth have become the servants of the Lord, and he is very highly exalted.

verses.ln1: Great is the Lord and highly to be praised
verses.ln2: in the city of our God, even upon his holy hill.

verses.ln1: The hill of Zion is beautiful and lofty;
verses.ln2: it is the joy of the whole earth.

verses.ln1: Upon the north side lies the city of the great King;
verses.ln2: God is well known in her palaces as a sure refuge.

verses.ln1: For behold, the kings of the earth
verses.ln2: have gathered and advanced together.

verses.ln1: They marvelled to see such things;
verses.ln2: they were astonished and fled in terror.

verses.ln1: Trembling came upon them, and anguish,
verses.ln2: as upon a woman in travail.

verses.ln1: You caused the east wind to blow
verses.ln2: and broke apart the ships of Tarshish.

verses.ln1: As we have heard, so have we seen in the city of the Lord of hosts, in the city of our God;
verses.ln2: God upholds her for ever.

verses.ln1: We wait for your loving-kindness, O God,
verses.ln2: in the midst of your temple.

verses.ln1: O God, according to your Name, so is your praise to the world’s end;
verses.ln2: your right hand is full of righteousness.

verses.ln1: Let Mount Zion rejoice, and the cities of Judah be glad,
verses.ln2: because of your judgments.

verses.ln1: Walk about Zion, and go round about her;
verses.ln2: count the number of her towers.

verses.ln1: Mark well her bulwarks, consider her strongholds,
verses.ln2: that you may tell those who come after.

verses.ln1: This God is our God for ever and ever;
verses.ln2: he shall be our guide, even unto death.

verses.ln1: Hear this, all you peoples;
verses.ln2: ponder it with your ears, all who dwell in the world,

verses.ln1: High and low, rich and poor,
verses.ln2: everyone with his neighbor.

verses.ln1: My mouth shall speak of wisdom,
verses.ln2: and my heart shall muse on understanding.

verses.ln1: I will incline my ear to a parable,
verses.ln2: and declare my dark sayings with the harp.

verses.ln1: Why should I fear in the days of wickedness,
verses.ln2: and when the wicked at my heels encompass me round about?

verses.ln1: There are some who put their trust in their goods,
verses.ln2: and boast in the multitude of their riches.

verses.ln1: But no one can deliver his brother,
verses.ln2: nor pay unto God a price for him;

verses.ln1: For it is so costly to redeem their souls,
verses.ln2: that we should never have enough to pay it,

verses.ln1: So that they should live for ever,
verses.ln2: and should not see the grave.

verses.ln1: For we see that wise men die, as well as the ignorant and foolish;
verses.ln2: they perish alike and leave their riches for others.

verses.ln1: And yet they think that their houses shall continue for ever, and that their dwelling places shall endure from one generation to another,
verses.ln2: and they call lands after their own names.

verses.ln1: Man is like an ox that has no understanding;
verses.ln2: he is like the beasts that perish.

verses.ln1: This is the way of their foolishness,
verses.ln2: yet their posterity praise their sayings.

verses.ln1: Like sheep they are appointed to die, and death shall be their shepherd;
verses.ln2: they shall go down straight into the sepulcher.

verses.ln1: Their beauty shall consume away in the grave,
verses.ln2: which shall be their dwelling place for ever.

verses.ln1: But God shall save me from the power of death,
verses.ln2: for he shall deliver my soul.

verses.ln1: Be not envious if one is made rich,
verses.ln2: or if the glory of his house is increased,

verses.ln1: For he shall carry nothing away with him when he dies,
verses.ln2: neither shall his glory follow him.

verses.ln1: For while he lived, he counted himself happy,
verses.ln2: and so long as he did well for himself, people spoke well of him.

verses.ln1: He shall follow the generation of his fathers
verses.ln2: and shall never see the light.

verses.ln1: Those who are honored but have no understanding
verses.ln2: are like the beasts that perish.

verses.ln1: The Lord, even the most mighty God, has spoken
verses.ln2: and called the world, from the rising of the sun to the going down thereof.

verses.ln1: Out of Zion, perfect in her beauty,
verses.ln2: has God shone forth in glory.

verses.ln1: Our God shall come and shall not keep silence;
verses.ln2: there shall go before him a consuming fire, and a mighty tempest shall be stirred up round about him.

verses.ln1: He shall call to the heavens above,
verses.ln2: and to the earth beneath, that he may judge his people:

verses.ln1: “Gather my faithful together unto me,
verses.ln2: those who have made a covenant with me by sacrifice.”

verses.ln1: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness,
verses.ln2: for God himself is Judge.

verses.ln1: “Hear, O my people, and I will speak;
verses.ln2: I myself will testify against you, O Israel, for I am God, even your God.

verses.ln1: I will not rebuke you because of your sacrifices, or for your burnt offerings,
verses.ln2: because they are always before me.

verses.ln1: I will take no bull calf out of your house,
verses.ln2: nor he-goat out of your folds.

verses.ln1: For all the beasts of the forest are mine,
verses.ln2: and so are the cattle upon a thousand hills.

verses.ln1: I know all the birds of the air,
verses.ln2: and the wild beasts of the field are in my sight.

verses.ln1: If I were hungry, I would not tell you,
verses.ln2: for the whole world is mine, and all that is therein.

verses.ln1: Do you think that I will eat the flesh of bulls
verses.ln2: and drink the blood of goats?

verses.ln1: Offer unto God a sacrifice of thanksgiving,
verses.ln2: and pay your vows unto the Most High,

verses.ln1: And call upon me in the time of trouble;
verses.ln2: so will I hear you, and you shall praise me.”

verses.ln1: But to the ungodly God says:
verses.ln2: “Why do you recite my laws, and take my covenant in your mouth,

verses.ln1: Though you hate to be disciplined,
verses.ln2: and have cast my words behind you?

verses.ln1: When you saw a thief, you agreed with him,
verses.ln2: and you have taken part with adulterers.

verses.ln1: You have let your mouth speak wickedness,
verses.ln2: and with your tongue you have set forth deceit.

verses.ln1: You sat and spoke against your brother;
verses.ln2: yes, and have slandered your own mother’s son.

verses.ln1: These things you have done, and I held my tongue,
verses.ln2: and you thought wickedly that I am such a one as yourself.

verses.ln1: But I will reprove you,
verses.ln2: and set before you the things that you have done.

verses.ln1: O consider this, you who forget God,
verses.ln2: lest I tear you in pieces, and there be none to deliver you.

verses.ln1: Whoever offers me a sacrifice of thanksgiving honors me,
verses.ln2: and to him who orders his way aright will I show the salvation of God.”

verses.ln1: Have mercy upon me, O God, in your great goodness;
verses.ln2: according to the multitude of your mercies wipe away my offences.

verses.ln1: Wash me thoroughly from my wickedness
verses.ln2: and cleanse me from my sin.

verses.ln1: For I acknowledge my faults,
verses.ln2: and my sin is ever before me.

verses.ln1: Against you only have I sinned, and done this evil in your sight,
verses.ln2: so that you are justified in your sentence, and blameless in your judgment.

verses.ln1: Behold, I was brought forth in wickedness,
verses.ln2: and in sin my mother conceived me.

verses.ln1: But behold, you desire truth in the inward parts
verses.ln2: and shall make me understand wisdom secretly.

verses.ln1: You shall purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean;
verses.ln2: you shall wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.

verses.ln1: You shall make me hear of joy and gladness,
verses.ln2: that the bones which you have broken may rejoice.

verses.ln1: Turn your face from my sins,
verses.ln2: and blot out all my misdeeds.

verses.ln1: Create in me a clean heart, O God,
verses.ln2: and renew a right spirit within me.

verses.ln1: Cast me not away from your presence,
verses.ln2: and take not your holy Spirit from me.

verses.ln1: O give me the comfort of your help again,
verses.ln2: and sustain me with your willing Spirit.

verses.ln1: Then shall I teach your ways unto the wicked,
verses.ln2: and sinners shall return unto you.

verses.ln1: Deliver me from blood-guilt, O God, the God of my salvation,
verses.ln2: and my tongue shall sing of your righteousness.

verses.ln1: O Lord, open my lips,
verses.ln2: and my mouth shall show forth your praise.

verses.ln1: For you desire no sacrifice, or else I would give it to you;
verses.ln2: but you delight not in burnt-offerings.

verses.ln1: The sacrifice of God is a troubled spirit;
verses.ln2: a broken and contrite heart, O God, you shall not despise.

verses.ln1: O be favorable and gracious unto Zion;
verses.ln2: may you build up the walls of Jerusalem.

verses.ln1: Then you shall be pleased with the sacrifice of righteousness, with the burnt-offerings and oblations;
verses.ln2: then shall they offer young bullocks upon your altar.

verses.ln1: Why do you boast, you tyrant,
verses.ln2: that you can do evil;

verses.ln1: Whereas the goodness of God
verses.ln2: endures all the day long?

verses.ln1: Your tongue devises wickedness,
verses.ln2: and with lies you cut like a sharp razor.

verses.ln1: You have loved unrighteousness more than goodness
verses.ln2: and to utter lies more than truth.

verses.ln1: You have loved to speak all words that hurt,
verses.ln2: O you deceitful tongue.

verses.ln1: Therefore, God shall destroy you for ever;
verses.ln2: he shall catch you, and pluck you out of your dwelling, and root you out of the land of the living.

verses.ln1: The righteous also shall see this and fear,
verses.ln2: and shall laugh him to scorn:

verses.ln1: “Behold, this is the one who did not take God for his strength,
verses.ln2: but trusted in the multitude of his riches and relied on his wickedness.”

verses.ln1: As for me, I am like a green olive tree in the house of God;
verses.ln2: my trust is in the tender mercy of God for ever and ever.

verses.ln1: I will always give thanks unto you for what you have done,
verses.ln2: and I will declare your Name among the faithful, for it is good.

verses.ln1: The fool has said in his heart,
verses.ln2: “There is no God.”

verses.ln1: They are corrupt and have become abominable in their wickedness;
verses.ln2: there is none that does good.

verses.ln1: God looked down from heaven upon the children of men
verses.ln2: to see if there were any who would understand and seek after God.

verses.ln1: But they have all gone astray; they have altogether become abominable;
verses.ln2: there is none that does good, no, not one.

verses.ln1: Have they no knowledge, all the workers of evil
verses.ln2: who eat up my people as they would eat bread, and call not upon God?

verses.ln1: They were afraid where no fear was,
verses.ln2: for God has broken the bones of those who besieged you;

verses.ln1: You have put them to shame,
verses.ln2: because God has rejected them.

verses.ln1: Oh, that salvation were given unto Israel out of Zion!
verses.ln2: Oh, that God would deliver his people out of captivity!

verses.ln1: Then shall Jacob rejoice,
verses.ln2: and Israel shall be glad.

verses.ln1: Save me, O God, for your Name’s sake,
verses.ln2: and avenge me in your strength.

verses.ln1: Hear my prayer, O God,
verses.ln2: and hearken to the words of my mouth.

verses.ln1: For the arrogant have risen up against me,
verses.ln2: and tyrants, who do not have God before their eyes, seek after my life.

verses.ln1: Behold, God is my helper;
verses.ln2: the Lord is he who upholds my life.

verses.ln1: He shall repay the evil of my enemies.
verses.ln2: O destroy them in your faithfulness.

verses.ln1: A freewill offering will I give you,
verses.ln2: and praise your Name, O Lord, because it is good.

verses.ln1: For he has delivered me out of all my trouble,
verses.ln2: and my eye has seen the ruin of my enemies.

verses.ln1: Hear my prayer, O God,
verses.ln2: and hide not yourself from my petition.

verses.ln1: Give heed to me, and hear me,
verses.ln2: for I am troubled in my prayer and am tormented,

verses.ln1: Because of the cry of the enemy, and oppression by the ungodly;
verses.ln2: for they are of a mind to do me great harm, so maliciously are they set against me.

verses.ln1: My heart is disquieted within me,
verses.ln2: and the fear of death has fallen upon me.

verses.ln1: Fearfulness and trembling have come upon me,
verses.ln2: and a horrible dread has overwhelmed me.

verses.ln1: And I said, “Oh, that I had wings like a dove,
verses.ln2: for then would I fly away and be at rest.

verses.ln1: Indeed, then I would get away to a far off place
verses.ln2: and make my dwelling in the wilderness.

verses.ln1: I would make haste to escape,
verses.ln2: because of the stormy wind and tempest.”

verses.ln1: Confuse their speech, O Lord, and divide them,
verses.ln2: for I have seen unrighteousness and strife in the city.

verses.ln1: Day and night they go about within her walls;
verses.ln2: trouble and sorrow are in the midst of her.

verses.ln1: Great wickedness is there;
verses.ln2: deceit and guile do not leave her streets.

verses.ln1: For it is not an enemy who has done me this dishonor,
verses.ln2: for then I could have borne it;

verses.ln1: Neither was it my adversary who exalted himself against me,
verses.ln2: for then I would have hidden myself from him.

verses.ln1: But it was you, my companion,
verses.ln2: my comrade and my own familiar friend.

verses.ln1: We took sweet counsel together
verses.ln2: and walked in the house of God as friends.

verses.ln1: Let death come hastily upon them, and let them go down alive into the grave,
verses.ln2: for there is wickedness in their hearts.

verses.ln1: As for me, I will call upon God,
verses.ln2: and the Lord shall save me.

verses.ln1: In the evening, and morning, and at noonday will I pray and lament,
verses.ln2: and he shall hear my voice.

verses.ln1: It is he who shall deliver my soul in peace from the battle that is against me,
verses.ln2: for there are many who fight me.

verses.ln1: God, who endures for ever, shall hear me and bring them down;
verses.ln2: for they never change, nor do they fear God.

verses.ln1: My familiar friend has laid his hands upon those who were at peace with him,
verses.ln2: and he has broken his covenant.

verses.ln1: The words of his mouth were softer than butter, yet war was in his heart;
verses.ln2: his words were smoother than oil, and yet they were drawn swords.

verses.ln1: O cast your burden upon the Lord, and he shall nourish you,
verses.ln2: and shall not allow the righteous to fall for ever.

verses.ln1: But as for the bloodthirsty and deceitful,
verses.ln2: you, O God, shall bring them into the pit of destruction.

verses.ln1: They shall not live out half their days;
verses.ln2: but my trust shall be in you, O Lord.

verses.ln1: Be merciful to me, O God, for my adversaries are treading me down;
verses.ln2: they are daily fighting and troubling me.

verses.ln1: My enemies go about hounding me daily,
verses.ln2: for there are many who fight against me, O Most High.

verses.ln1: Nevertheless, though I am sometimes afraid,
verses.ln2: yet I put my trust in you.

verses.ln1: In God whose word I praise, in God I trust and fear not,
verses.ln2: for what can flesh do to me?

verses.ln1: They daily distort my words;
verses.ln2: all that they imagine is to do me evil.

verses.ln1: They all gather together and lie in wait,
verses.ln2: and mark my steps, while they seek after my life.

verses.ln1: Shall they escape despite their wickedness?
verses.ln2: O God, in your displeasure cast them down.

verses.ln1: You record my lamentation; put my tears into your bottle.
verses.ln2: Are not these things noted in your book?

verses.ln1: Whenever I call upon you, then shall my enemies be put to flight;
verses.ln2: this I know, for God is on my side.

verses.ln1: In God, whose word I praise,
verses.ln2: in the Lord, whose word I praise,

verses.ln1: In God have I put my trust;
verses.ln2: I will not be afraid, for what can mortals do to me?

verses.ln1: Unto you, O God, will I pay my vows;
verses.ln2: unto you will I give thanks.

verses.ln1: For you have delivered my soul from death and my feet from stumbling,
verses.ln2: that I may walk before God in the light of the living.

verses.ln1: Be merciful to me, O God, be merciful to me, for my soul trusts in you,
verses.ln2: and under the shadow of your wings shall be my refuge, until this tribulation has passed.

verses.ln1: I will call unto the Most High God,
verses.ln2: even unto the God who shall fulfill his purpose for me.

verses.ln1: He shall send from heaven and save me; he shall confound those who trample on me.
verses.ln2: God shall send forth his mercy and truth.

verses.ln1: My soul is among lions that devour the people;
verses.ln2: their teeth are spears and arrows, and their tongue a sharp sword.

verses.ln1: Exalt yourself, O God, above the heavens;
verses.ln2: let your glory be over all the earth.

verses.ln1: They have laid a net for my feet, and brought down my soul;
verses.ln2: they dug a pit before me, but have fallen into the midst of it themselves.

verses.ln1: My heart is firmly fixed, O God, my heart is fixed;
verses.ln2: I will sing and give praise.

verses.ln1: Awake, my soul; awake, lute and harp;
verses.ln2: I myself will awaken the dawn.

verses.ln1: I will give thanks unto you, O Lord, among the peoples,
verses.ln2: and I will sing praises unto you among the nations.

verses.ln1: For the greatness of your mercy reaches unto the heavens,
verses.ln2: and your truth unto the clouds.

verses.ln1: Exalt yourself, O God, above the heavens;
verses.ln2: let your glory be over all the earth.

verses.ln1: Do you indeed decree righteousness, O you rulers,
verses.ln2: and do you judge uprightly, O children of men?

verses.ln1: No, you devise evil in your heart,
verses.ln2: and on the earth your hands deal out violence.

verses.ln1: The ungodly err even from their mother’s womb;
verses.ln2: as soon as they are born, they go astray and speak lies.

verses.ln1: They are as venomous as the poison of a serpent,
verses.ln2: even like the deaf adder that stops its ears,

verses.ln1: Which refuses to hear the voice of the charmer,
verses.ln2: no matter how skillful his charming.

verses.ln1: Break their teeth, O God, in their mouths;
verses.ln2: smite the jawbones of the ungodly.

verses.ln1: Let them fall away like water that runs off;
verses.ln2: let them wither like the grass that is trodden underfoot.

verses.ln1: Let them melt away like a snail,
verses.ln2: and be like a stillborn child that does not see the sun.

verses.ln1: Before they bear fruit, let them be cut off like a briar;
verses.ln2: let them be like thorns and weeds that are swept away.

verses.ln1: The righteous shall rejoice when they see the vengeance;
verses.ln2: they shall wash their feet in the blood of the ungodly.

verses.ln1: So that people shall say, “Truly, there is a reward for the righteous;
verses.ln2: surely, there is a God who judges the earth.”

verses.ln1: Deliver me from my enemies, O God;
verses.ln2: defend me from those who rise up against me.

verses.ln1: O deliver me from the evildoers,
verses.ln2: and save me from the bloodthirsty.

verses.ln1: For behold, they lie in wait for my soul;
verses.ln2: the mighty are gathered against me, without any offense or fault of mine, O Lord.

verses.ln1: They run and prepare themselves without cause.
verses.ln2: Arise therefore to help me, and behold.

verses.ln1: Rise up, O Lord God of hosts, O God of Israel, to visit all the nations,
verses.ln2: and be not merciful to those who offend with malicious wickedness.

verses.ln1: They go to and fro in the evening;
verses.ln2: they howl like dogs, and run about through the city.

verses.ln1: Behold, they boast with their mouths, and taunts are on their lips,
verses.ln2: for they say, “Who will hear us?”

verses.ln1: But you, O Lord, shall hold them in derision,
verses.ln2: and you shall laugh all the nations to scorn.

verses.ln1: My strength I will ascribe unto you,
verses.ln2: for you are the God of my refuge.

verses.ln1: God shows me his plenteous goodness,
verses.ln2: and God shall let me look in triumph upon my enemies.

verses.ln1: Slay them not, lest my people forget it,
verses.ln2: but scatter them abroad by your might, and put them down, O Lord our shield.

verses.ln1: For the sin of their mouth, and for the words of their lips, they shall be taken in their pride,
verses.ln2: because their talk is cursing and lies.

verses.ln1: Consume them in your wrath; consume them, that they may perish,
verses.ln2: and know that it is God who rules in Jacob, and unto the ends of the world.

verses.ln1: In the evening they will return,
verses.ln2: howl like dogs, and run about through the city.

verses.ln1: They will run here and there for meat
verses.ln2: and growl if they are not satisfied.

verses.ln1: As for me, I will sing of your power, and will praise your mercy early in the morning,
verses.ln2: for you have been my defense and refuge in the day of my trouble.

verses.ln1: Unto you, O my strength, will I sing,
verses.ln2: for you, O God, are my refuge, and my merciful God.

verses.ln1: O God, you have cast us out and scattered us abroad;
verses.ln2: you have been so displeased; O turn unto us again.

verses.ln1: You have made the land to quake and divided it;
verses.ln2: heal the breaches in it, for it shakes.

verses.ln1: You have made your people to drink a cup of bitterness;
verses.ln2: you have filled us with wine that makes us stagger.

verses.ln1: You have set up a banner for those who fear you,
verses.ln2: that they may triumph because of the truth.

verses.ln1: That your beloved may be delivered,
verses.ln2: help me with your right hand and hear me.

verses.ln1: God has spoken in his holiness:
verses.ln2: “I will rejoice and divide Shechem, and parcel out the valley of Succoth.

verses.ln1: Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine;
verses.ln2: Ephraim also is the helmet for my head; Judah is my scepter.

verses.ln1: Moab is my wash pot; on Edom I will cast my shoe;
verses.ln2: over Philistia will I shout in triumph.”

verses.ln1: Who will lead me into the strong city?
verses.ln2: Who will bring me into Edom?

verses.ln1: Have you not cast us out, O God?
verses.ln2: Will you not, O God, go out with our armies?

verses.ln1: O be our help in trouble,
verses.ln2: for vain is the help of man.

verses.ln1: Through God we will do great acts,
verses.ln2: for it is he who shall tread down our enemies.

verses.ln1: Hear my cry, O God;
verses.ln2: give ear unto my prayer.

verses.ln1: From the ends of the earth I will call upon you
verses.ln2: when my heart is in heaviness.

verses.ln1: O set me upon the rock that is higher than I,
verses.ln2: for you have been my refuge and a strong tower for me against the enemy.

verses.ln1: Let me dwell in your tabernacle for ever,
verses.ln2: and my refuge shall be under the covering of your wings.

verses.ln1: For you, O God, have heard my vows,
verses.ln2: and have given a heritage to those who fear your Name.

verses.ln1: You shall grant the king a long life,
verses.ln2: that his years may endure throughout all generations.

verses.ln1: His throne shall abide before God for ever;
verses.ln2: O prepare your loving mercy and faithfulness, that they may preserve him.

verses.ln1: So will I always sing praise unto your Name,
verses.ln2: that I may daily perform my vows.

verses.ln1: For God alone my soul in silence waits;
verses.ln2: from him comes my salvation.

verses.ln1: He truly is my strength and my salvation;
verses.ln2: he is my defense, so that I shall not be greatly shaken.

verses.ln1: How long will you assail a man to crush him, all of you together,
verses.ln2: as if you were a tottering wall or a broken fence?

verses.ln1: Their plan is only to bring down the one whom God has exalted;
verses.ln2: their delight is in lies; they bless with their mouth, but curse with their heart.

verses.ln1: Nevertheless, for God alone my soul in silence waits,
verses.ln2: for my hope is in him.

verses.ln1: He truly is my strength and my salvation;
verses.ln2: he is my defense, so that I shall not fall.

verses.ln1: In God is my help and my glory;
verses.ln2: he is the rock of my might, and in him is my trust.

verses.ln1: O put your trust in him always, you people;
verses.ln2: pour out your hearts before him, for God is our hope.

verses.ln1: As for the children of men, they are but a breath;
verses.ln2: the children of men are deceitful; upon the scales, they are altogether lighter than a breath.

verses.ln1: O trust not in oppression; put not vain hopes in robbery;
verses.ln2: if riches increase, set not your heart upon them.

verses.ln1: One thing has God spoken; indeed, two things have I heard him say:
verses.ln2: that power belongs to our God;

verses.ln1: And that you, O Lord, are merciful,
verses.ln2: for you reward everyone according to his work.

verses.ln1: O God, you are my God;
verses.ln2: early will I seek you.

verses.ln1: My soul thirsts for you, my flesh also longs after you,
verses.ln2: in a barren and dry land where there is no water.

verses.ln1: Thus I have looked upon you in your holy place,
verses.ln2: that I might behold your power and glory.

verses.ln1: For your loving-kindness is better than life itself;
verses.ln2: my lips shall praise you.

verses.ln1: As long as I live I will magnify you,
verses.ln2: and lift up my hands in your Name.

verses.ln1: My soul shall be satisfied, as with marrow and fatness,
verses.ln2: when my mouth praises you with joyful lips.

verses.ln1: When I remember you on my bed,
verses.ln2: I meditate on you in the watches of the night.

verses.ln1: Because you have been my helper,
verses.ln2: therefore under the shadow of your wings I will rejoice.

verses.ln1: My soul clings to you;
verses.ln2: your right hand has upheld me.

verses.ln1: Those who seek to destroy my life
verses.ln2: shall go down into the earth.

verses.ln1: Let them fall upon the edge of the sword,
verses.ln2: that they may be a portion for jackals.

verses.ln1: But the King shall rejoice in God; all those who swear by him shall be commended,
verses.ln2: for the mouth of those who speak lies shall be stopped.

verses.ln1: Hear my voice, O God, in my prayer;
verses.ln2: preserve my life from fear of the enemy.

verses.ln1: Hide me from the gathering together of the wicked,
verses.ln2: and from the tumult of evildoers,

verses.ln1: Who have whet their tongue like a sword,
verses.ln2: and shoot out their arrows, even bitter words,

verses.ln1: That they may secretly shoot at the one who is blameless;
verses.ln2: suddenly do they shoot him, and fear not.

verses.ln1: They hold fast to their evil purpose,
verses.ln2: and discuss among themselves how they may lay snares, and say that no one shall see them.

verses.ln1: They imagine wickedness, and practice a cunning plot;
verses.ln2: for the human heart and mind are very deep.

verses.ln1: But God shall suddenly shoot at them with a swift arrow,
verses.ln2: and they shall be wounded.

verses.ln1: Indeed, their own tongues shall make them fall,
verses.ln2: so that all who see them shall laugh them to scorn.

verses.ln1: And all shall fear and tell what God has done,
verses.ln2: for they shall perceive that it is his work.

verses.ln1: The righteous shall rejoice in the Lord and put their trust in him,
verses.ln2: and all who are true of heart shall be glad.

verses.ln1: You, O God, are to be praised in Zion,
verses.ln2: and unto you shall vows be performed in Jerusalem.

verses.ln1: You who hear our prayer,
verses.ln2: unto you shall all flesh come.

verses.ln1: My misdeeds prevail against me;
verses.ln2: O be merciful and blot out our sins.

verses.ln1: Blessed is the man whom you choose and receive unto yourself;
verses.ln2: he shall dwell in your courts, and shall be satisfied with the pleasures of your house, even of your holy temple.

verses.ln1: You shall show us wonderful things in your righteousness, O God of our salvation,
verses.ln2: for you are the hope of all the ends of the earth and of the isles that are far away.

verses.ln1: You in your strength set firm the mountains,
verses.ln2: and are girded about with power.

verses.ln1: You still the raging of the seas,
verses.ln2: the noise of their waves, and the tumult of the peoples.

verses.ln1: Those who dwell in the uttermost parts of the earth shall be in fear of your wonders;
verses.ln2: you make the morning and evening to shout with joy.

verses.ln1: You visit the earth and bless it;
verses.ln2: you make it very plenteous.

verses.ln1: The river of God is full of water;
verses.ln2: you prepare the grain, for so you provide for the earth.

verses.ln1: You water its furrows; you send rain into the little valleys;
verses.ln2: you make it soft with the drops of rain and bless the increase of it.

verses.ln1: You crown the year with your goodness,
verses.ln2: and your paths overflow with plenty.

verses.ln1: The fields of the wilderness are rich in pasture,
verses.ln2: and the little hills rejoice on every side.

verses.ln1: The folds shall be full of sheep;
verses.ln2: the valleys also shall stand so thick with grain that they shall laugh and sing.

verses.ln1: Be joyful in God, all you lands;
verses.ln2: sing praises to the honor of his Name; make his praise to be glorious.

verses.ln1: Say to God, “How wonderful are your works;
verses.ln2: through the greatness of your power shall your enemies cower before you.

verses.ln1: For all the world shall worship you,
verses.ln2: sing to you, and praise your Name.”

verses.ln1: O come and see the works of God,
verses.ln2: how wonderful he is in his doing toward all people.

verses.ln1: He turned the sea into dry land, so that they went through the water on foot;
verses.ln2: therefore in him let us rejoice.

verses.ln1: He rules with his power for ever; his eyes keep watch over the nations;
verses.ln2: let not the rebellious exalt themselves.

verses.ln1: Bless our God, you peoples,
verses.ln2: and make the voice of his praise to be heard,

verses.ln1: Who holds our soul in life,
verses.ln2: and does not allow our feet to slip.

verses.ln1: For you, O God, have proved us;
verses.ln2: you have tried us, as silver is tried.

verses.ln1: You brought us into the snare
verses.ln2: and laid trouble upon our backs.

verses.ln1: You allowed men to ride over our heads; we went through fire and water;
verses.ln2: but you brought us out into a place of plenty.

verses.ln1: I will go into your house with burnt offerings
verses.ln2: and will pay you my vows,

verses.ln1: Even those which I promised with my lips
verses.ln2: and spoke with my mouth when I was in trouble.

verses.ln1: I will offer you burnt sacrifices of fattened beasts, with the incense of rams;
verses.ln2: I will offer bullocks and goats.

verses.ln1: Come here and listen, all you who fear God,
verses.ln2: and I will tell you what he has done for me.

verses.ln1: I called to him with my mouth,
verses.ln2: and gave him praises with my tongue.

verses.ln1: If I had inclined toward wickedness with my heart,
verses.ln2: the Lord would not have heard me.

verses.ln1: But God has heard me
verses.ln2: and considered the voice of my prayer.

verses.ln1: Blessed be God who has not refused my prayer,
verses.ln2: nor turned his mercy from me.

verses.ln1: May God be merciful unto us, and bless us,
verses.ln2: and show us the light of his countenance, and be merciful unto us.

verses.ln1: Let your way be known upon earth,
verses.ln2: your saving health among all nations.

verses.ln1: Let the peoples praise you, O God;
verses.ln2: indeed, let all the peoples praise you.

verses.ln1: O let the nations rejoice and be glad,
verses.ln2: for you shall judge the peoples righteously, and govern the nations upon earth.

verses.ln1: Let the peoples praise you, O God;
verses.ln2: let all the peoples praise you.

verses.ln1: Then shall the earth bring forth her increase,
verses.ln2: and God, even our own God, shall give us his blessing.

verses.ln1: God shall bless us,
verses.ln2: and all the ends of the world shall fear him.

verses.ln1: Let God arise, and let his enemies be scattered;
verses.ln2: let those who hate him also flee before him.

verses.ln1: As the smoke vanishes, so shall you drive them away;
verses.ln2: and as wax melts before the fire, so let the ungodly perish before the presence of God.

verses.ln1: But let the righteous be glad and rejoice before God;
verses.ln2: let them also be merry and joyful.

verses.ln1: O sing unto God, and sing praises unto his Name; magnify
verses.ln2: him who rides upon the heavens.

verses.ln1:
The Lord is his Name; rejoice before him. 
He is a father of the fatherless and defends the cause of the widows,
verses.ln2: God in his holy habitation.

verses.ln1: He is the God who gives the solitary a home, and brings the prisoners out of captivity,
verses.ln2: but lets the rebellious dwell in a desert land.

verses.ln1: O God, when you went forth before the people,
verses.ln2: when you went through the wilderness,

verses.ln1: The earth shook, and the heavens poured forth rain at the presence of God,
verses.ln2: even as Sinai also was moved at the presence of God, who is the God of Israel.

verses.ln1: You, O God, sent a gracious rain upon your inheritance
verses.ln2: and refreshed the land when it was weary.

verses.ln1: Your congregation found a dwelling there,
verses.ln2: for you, O God, of your goodness have provided for the poor.

verses.ln1: The Lord gave the word;
verses.ln2: great was the company of those who proclaimed the tidings.

verses.ln1: Kings with their armies fled, they fled,
verses.ln2: and the women at home divided the spoil.

verses.ln1: Though you have lain among the sheepfolds,
verses.ln2: yet shall you be like the wings of a dove that are covered with silver, and whose feathers shine like gold.

verses.ln1: When the Almighty scattered kings,
verses.ln2: it was as if it snowed in Zalmon.

verses.ln1: As the hill of Bashan, so is God’s hill,
verses.ln2: even a high hill, as the hill of Bashan.

verses.ln1: Why look with envy, you high hills? This is God’s hill, on which it pleases him to dwell;
verses.ln2: surely, the Lord will abide on it for ever.

verses.ln1: The chariots of God are twenty thousand, even thousands of angels,
verses.ln2: and the Lord has come from Sinai into the holy place.

verses.ln1: You have gone up on high; you have led captivity captive, and received gifts from men,
verses.ln2: even from your enemies, that the Lord God might dwell among them.

verses.ln1: Praised be the Lord daily,
verses.ln2: even the God who helps us and pours his benefits upon us.

verses.ln1: He is our God, the God from whom salvation comes;
verses.ln2: God is the Lord, by whom we escape death.

verses.ln1: God shall wound the head of his enemies,
verses.ln2: and the hairy scalp of those who persist in their wickedness.

verses.ln1: The Lord has said, “I will bring back my people again, as I did from Bashan;
verses.ln2: my own will I bring back again, as I did before from the depths of the sea,

verses.ln1: That your foot may be dipped in the blood of your enemies,
verses.ln2: and that the tongues of your dogs may be red with blood.”

verses.ln1: Your solemn procession is seen, O God,
verses.ln2: how you go into the sanctuary, my God and King.

verses.ln1: The singers go before, the musicians follow after;
verses.ln2: in the midst are the maidens playing the timbrels.

verses.ln1: Give thanks unto God in the congregations,
verses.ln2: unto the Lord, the fountain of Israel.

verses.ln1: There is little Benjamin their ruler, and the princes of Judah their counsel,
verses.ln2: the princes of Zebulon, and the princes of Naphtali.

verses.ln1: O God, send forth your strength;
verses.ln2: establish, O God, what you have wrought in us.

verses.ln1: For your temple’s sake at Jerusalem,
verses.ln2: kings shall bring presents unto you.

verses.ln1: Rebuke the beasts that dwell among the reeds,
verses.ln2: a herd of bulls with their calves;

verses.ln1: Rebuke the peoples who trample on those whom you have tried as silver,
verses.ln2: and scatter the peoples who delight in war.

verses.ln1: Then shall they bring tribute out of Egypt;
verses.ln2: Ethiopia shall stretch out her hands unto God.

verses.ln1: Sing unto God, O you kingdoms of the earth;
verses.ln2: O sing praises unto the Lord,

verses.ln1: Unto God who sits in the heavens over all from the beginning;
verses.ln2: he sends out his voice, his mighty voice.

verses.ln1: Ascribe power to God over Israel;
verses.ln2: his worship and strength are in the clouds.

verses.ln1: O God, you are wonderful in your holy places;
verses.ln2: the God of Israel will give strength and power to his people. Blessed be God.

verses.ln1: Save me, O God,
verses.ln2: for the waters have come up even to my neck.

verses.ln1: I sink down in the deep mire, where there is no ground;
verses.ln2: I have come into deep waters, so that the floods run over me.

verses.ln1: I am weary of crying; my throat is dry;
verses.ln2: my sight fails me from waiting so long for my God.

verses.ln1: Those who hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of my head;
verses.ln2: those who are my enemies, and would destroy me wrongfully, are mighty.

verses.ln1: They bid me restore things I never took.
verses.ln2: O God, you know my foolishness, and my faults are not hidden from you.

verses.ln1: Let not those who trust in you, O Lord God of hosts, be ashamed because of me;
verses.ln2: let not those who seek you be confounded through me, O God of Israel.

verses.ln1: Surely for your sake have I suffered reproach;
verses.ln2: shame has covered my face.

verses.ln1: I have become a stranger to my brethren,
verses.ln2: unknown to my mother’s children,

verses.ln1: Because zeal for your house has consumed me,
verses.ln2: and the reproaches of those who reproached you have fallen upon me.

verses.ln1: I wept, and humbled myself with fasting,
verses.ln2: but that was turned to my reproach.

verses.ln1: I put on sackcloth also,
verses.ln2: and I became a byword among them.

verses.ln1: Those who sit in the gate speak against me,
verses.ln2: and the drunkards make songs about me.

verses.ln1: But, Lord, I make my prayer to you
verses.ln2: in an acceptable time.

verses.ln1: Hear me, O God, in the multitude of your mercy,
verses.ln2: even in the truth of your salvation.

verses.ln1: Take me out of the mire, lest I sink;
verses.ln2: O let me be delivered from those who hate me, and out of the deep waters.

verses.ln1: Let not the floodwaters drown me, neither let the deep swallow me up,
verses.ln2: and let not the pit shut its mouth upon me.

verses.ln1: Hear me, O Lord, for your loving-kindness is good;
verses.ln2: turn to me according to the multitude of your mercies;

verses.ln1: And hide not your face from your servant, for I am in trouble;
verses.ln2: O hasten and hear me.

verses.ln1: Draw near to me and save me;
verses.ln2: O deliver me because of my enemies.

verses.ln1: You have known my reproach, my shame, and my dishonor;
verses.ln2: my adversaries are all in your sight.

verses.ln1: Reproach has broken my heart; I am full of heaviness;
verses.ln2: I looked for some to have pity on me, but there was no one, neither have I found any to comfort me.

verses.ln1: They gave me gall to eat,
verses.ln2: and when I was thirsty they gave me vinegar to drink.

verses.ln1: Let their table become a snare for them,
verses.ln2: and let their prosperity become a trap for them.

verses.ln1: Let their eyes be blinded, that they may not see,
verses.ln2: and make their loins tremble continually.

verses.ln1: Pour out your indignation upon them,
verses.ln2: and let your wrathful displeasure overtake them.

verses.ln1: Let their habitation be desolate,
verses.ln2: and let no one dwell in their tents.

verses.ln1: For they persecute him whom you have stricken,
verses.ln2: and they talk of the pain of those you have wounded.

verses.ln1: Lay to their charge guilt upon guilt,
verses.ln2: and let them not receive your vindication.

verses.ln1: Let them be wiped out of the book of the living,
verses.ln2: and not be written among the righteous.

verses.ln1: As for me, when I am poor and in pain,
verses.ln2: your help, O God, shall lift me up.

verses.ln1: I will praise the Name of God with a song,
verses.ln2: and magnify it with thanksgiving.

verses.ln1: This also shall please the Lord
verses.ln2: more than an ox or a bullock that has horns and hooves.

verses.ln1: The humble shall consider this and be glad;
verses.ln2: seek after God and your hearts shall live.

verses.ln1: For the Lord hears the poor
verses.ln2: and does not despise his prisoners.

verses.ln1: Let heaven and earth praise him,
verses.ln2: the sea, and all that moves therein.

verses.ln1: For God will save Zion and build the cities of Judah,
verses.ln2: that they may dwell there and have it in possession.

verses.ln1: The posterity of his servants shall inherit it,
verses.ln2: and those who love his Name shall dwell therein.

verses.ln1: Hasten, O God, to deliver me;
verses.ln2: make haste to help me, O Lord.

verses.ln1: Let them be ashamed and confounded who seek after my life;
verses.ln2: let them be turned back and put to confusion who wish me evil.

verses.ln1: Let them be soon brought to shame
verses.ln2: who cry over me, “Aha! Aha!”

verses.ln1: But let all those who seek you be joyful and glad in you;
verses.ln2: and let all who delight in your salvation say always, “The Lord be praised.”

verses.ln1: As for me, I am poor and in misery;
verses.ln2: hasten to me, O God.

verses.ln1: You are my helper and my deliverer;
verses.ln2: O Lord, do not tarry.

verses.ln1: In you, O Lord, have I put my trust;
verses.ln2: let me never be put to shame.

verses.ln1: Rescue me and deliver me in your righteousness;
verses.ln2: incline your ear to me and save me.

verses.ln1: Be my rock and my refuge, where I may always return;
verses.ln2: you have promised to help me, for you are my stronghold and my fortress.

verses.ln1: Deliver me, O my God, out of the hand of the ungodly,
verses.ln2: out of the hand of the unrighteous and the cruel.

verses.ln1: For you, O Lord God, are the one I long for;
verses.ln2: you are my hope, even from my youth.

verses.ln1: Through you have I been upheld ever since I was born;
verses.ln2: you took me out of my mother’s womb; my praise shall be always of you.

verses.ln1: I have become a portent to many;
verses.ln2: but you are my refuge and my strength.

verses.ln1: O let my mouth be filled with your praise,
verses.ln2: that I may sing of your glory all the day long.

verses.ln1: Cast me not away in the time of old age;
verses.ln2: forsake me not when my strength fails me.

verses.ln1: For my enemies speak against me, and those who lie in wait for my life take counsel together.
verses.ln2: They say, “God has forsaken him; pursue him and take him, for there is none to deliver him.”

verses.ln1: Go not far from me, O God;
verses.ln2: my God, make haste to help me.

verses.ln1: Let those who are my adversaries be confounded and perish;
verses.ln2: let those who seek to do me evil be covered with shame and dishonor.

verses.ln1: As for me, I will always patiently abide,
verses.ln2: and will praise you more and more.

verses.ln1: My mouth shall speak daily of your righteousness and salvation,
verses.ln2: for I know not the end of them.

verses.ln1: I will go forth in the strength of the Lord God,
verses.ln2: and will make mention of your righteousness, yours alone.

verses.ln1: You, O God, have taught me from my youth;
verses.ln2: even to this day I am telling of your wondrous works.

verses.ln1: Forsake me not, O God, in my old age, when I am gray-headed,
verses.ln2: until I have proclaimed your strength to this generation, and your power to all those who are yet to come.

verses.ln1: Your righteousness, O God, reaches to the heavens;
verses.ln2: you have done great things. Who is like you, O God?

verses.ln1: Oh, what great troubles and adversities you have shown me! And yet you have turned and refreshed me;
verses.ln2: indeed, you have brought me again from the depths of the earth.

verses.ln1: You have brought me to great honor
verses.ln2: and comforted me on every side;

verses.ln1: Therefore will I praise you and your faithfulness, O God, playing on a stringed instrument;
verses.ln2: to you will I sing with the harp, O Holy One of Israel.

verses.ln1: My lips will rejoice when I sing to you,
verses.ln2: and so will my soul, which you have delivered.

verses.ln1: My tongue also shall speak of your righteousness all the day long,
verses.ln2: for they are confounded and brought to shame who seek to do me evil.

verses.ln1: Give the King your judgments, O God,
verses.ln2: and your righteousness to the King’s son.

verses.ln1: Then shall he judge your people with righteousness
verses.ln2: and defend the poor with justice.

verses.ln1: The mountains also shall bring peace,
verses.ln2: and the little hills righteousness to the people.

verses.ln1: He shall vindicate the poor among the people,
verses.ln2: defend the children of the poor, and punish the wrongdoer.

verses.ln1: They shall fear you as long as the sun and moon endure,
verses.ln2: from one generation to another.

verses.ln1: He shall come down like the rain upon the mown grass,
verses.ln2: even as showers that water the earth.

verses.ln1: In his time shall the righteous flourish,
verses.ln2: even an abundance of peace, so long as the moon endures.

verses.ln1: His dominion shall be also from one sea to the other,
verses.ln2: and from the river unto the world’s end.

verses.ln1: Those who dwell in the wilderness shall kneel before him;
verses.ln2: his enemies shall lick the dust.

verses.ln1: The kings of Tarshish and of the isles shall give presents;
verses.ln2: the kings of Arabia and Seba shall bring gifts.

verses.ln1: All kings shall fall down before him;
verses.ln2: all nations shall do him service.

verses.ln1: For he shall deliver the poor when he cries,
verses.ln2: the needy also, and the one that has no helper.

verses.ln1: He shall be favorable to the lowly and needy,
verses.ln2: and shall preserve the lives of the poor.

verses.ln1: He shall deliver them from falsehood and wrong,
verses.ln2: and dear shall their blood be in his sight.

verses.ln1: Long may he live! And unto him shall be given the gold of Arabia;
verses.ln2: prayer shall ever be made unto him, and daily shall he be blessed.

verses.ln1: There shall be an abundance of grain on the earth, thick upon the hilltops;
verses.ln2: its fruit shall flourish like Lebanon, its grain like the grass upon the earth.

verses.ln1: His Name shall endure for ever; his Name shall remain as long as the sun.
verses.ln2: All the nations shall be blessed through him and shall call him blessed.

verses.ln1: Blessed be the Lord God, even the God of Israel,
verses.ln2: who alone does wondrous things;

verses.ln1: And blessed be the Name of his majesty for ever;
verses.ln2:
and all the earth shall be filled with his majesty. 
Amen, Amen.

verses.ln1: Truly, God is loving to Israel,
verses.ln2: even to those who have a clean heart.

verses.ln1: Nevertheless, my feet had almost stumbled;
verses.ln2: my steps had nearly slipped.

verses.ln1: For I was envious of the proud
verses.ln2: when I saw the ungodly in such prosperity.

verses.ln1: For they are in no fear of death,
verses.ln2: but their bodies are healthy and strong.

verses.ln1: They come to no misfortune like other folk,
verses.ln2: neither are they afflicted like others.

verses.ln1: Therefore they wear pride as a necklace,
verses.ln2: and they wrap themselves with violence as with a garment.

verses.ln1: Their eyes swell with greed,
verses.ln2: and their hearts overflow with wicked thoughts.

verses.ln1: Their talk is malice and mockery;
verses.ln2: they have proud looks, and tyrannous words are on their lips.

verses.ln1: For they set their mouth against the heavens,
verses.ln2: and their evil speech spreads through the world.

verses.ln1: Therefore the people turn to them,
verses.ln2: and find no fault in them.

verses.ln1: They say, “How should God perceive it?
verses.ln2: Is there knowledge in the Most High?”

verses.ln1: Behold, these are the ungodly;
verses.ln2: they prosper in their ways, and they have riches in possession.

verses.ln1: I said, “Surely in vain have I cleansed my heart
verses.ln2: and washed my hands in innocence.

verses.ln1: All the day long have I been afflicted,
verses.ln2: and chastened every morning.

verses.ln1: Indeed, had I spoken as they do,
verses.ln2: then would I have betrayed the generation of your children.

verses.ln1: When I sought to understand this,
verses.ln2: it was too hard for me,

verses.ln1: Until I went into the sanctuary of God;
verses.ln2: then I understood their end.

verses.ln1: Surely, you set them in slippery places,
verses.ln2: and cast them down, and destroy them.

verses.ln1: Oh, how suddenly are they consumed;
verses.ln2: they perish and come to a fearful end.

verses.ln1: Indeed, like a dream when one awakens,
verses.ln2: so shall you make their image vanish out of the city.

verses.ln1: Thus my heart was grieved,
verses.ln2: and I was wounded within;

verses.ln1: So foolish was I, and ignorant,
verses.ln2: as if I were a beast before you.

verses.ln1: Nevertheless, I am always with you,
verses.ln2: for you hold me by my right hand.

verses.ln1: You shall guide me with your counsel,
verses.ln2: and after that receive me with glory.

verses.ln1: Whom have I in heaven but you?
verses.ln2: And there is no one on earth whom I desire in comparison with you.

verses.ln1: Though my flesh and my heart fail me,
verses.ln2: God is the strength of my heart, and my portion for ever.

verses.ln1: For behold, those who forsake you shall perish;
verses.ln2: you destroy all those who are unfaithful to you.

verses.ln1: But it is good for me to hold fast to God, to put my trust in the Lord God,
verses.ln2: and to speak of all your works in the gates of the city of Zion.

verses.ln1: O God, why have you utterly cast us off ?
verses.ln2: Why is your wrath so hot against the sheep of your pasture?

verses.ln1: O think upon your congregation
verses.ln2: whom you have purchased and redeemed of old.

verses.ln1: Think upon the tribe of your inheritance,
verses.ln2: and Mount Zion, where you have dwelt.

verses.ln1: Draw near and behold how all is made desolate
verses.ln2: and how the enemy has destroyed all that is in your sanctuary.

verses.ln1: Your adversaries roar in the midst of your holy place
verses.ln2: and set up their banners as tokens of victory.

verses.ln1: Like hewers of timber in a thicket of trees,
verses.ln2: so have they broken down all the carved work with axes and hammers.

verses.ln1: They have set fire to your holy place
verses.ln2: and have defiled the dwelling place of your Name, even to the ground.

verses.ln1: They said in their hearts, “Let us make havoc of them altogether.”
verses.ln2: Thus have they burnt up all the houses of God in the land.

verses.ln1: We do not see any signs; there is not one prophet anymore;
verses.ln2: there is no one who knows how long these things shall continue.

verses.ln1: O God, how long shall the adversary do this dishonor?
verses.ln2: How long shall the enemy blaspheme your Name, for ever?

verses.ln1: Why do you withdraw your hand?
verses.ln2: Why do you not take your right hand out of your bosom to consume the enemy?

verses.ln1: For God is my King of old;
verses.ln2: he is the one bringing help upon the earth.

verses.ln1: You divided the sea through your power;
verses.ln2: you broke the heads of the dragons in the waters.

verses.ln1: You smote the heads of Leviathan in pieces
verses.ln2: and gave him to be food for the people in the wilderness.

verses.ln1: You brought fountains and waters out of the hard rocks,
verses.ln2: and you dried up mighty waters.

verses.ln1: The day is yours, and the night is yours;
verses.ln2: you have prepared the light and the sun.

verses.ln1: You have set all the borders of the earth;
verses.ln2: you have made summer and winter.

verses.ln1: Remember this, O Lord, how the enemy scoffed,
verses.ln2: and how the foolish people have blasphemed your Name.

verses.ln1: Deliver not the soul of your turtledove to the wild beasts,
verses.ln2: and forget not for ever the lives of your poor.

verses.ln1: Look upon your covenant,
verses.ln2: for the dark places of the earth are full of violence.

verses.ln1: Let not the oppressed go away ashamed,
verses.ln2: but let the poor and needy give praise to your Name.

verses.ln1: Arise, O God, maintain your own cause;
verses.ln2: remember how the foolish one blasphemes you daily.

verses.ln1: Forget not the voice of your enemies,
verses.ln2: nor the tumult of those who hate you, which increases ever more and more.

verses.ln1: Unto you, O God, do we give thanks;
verses.ln2: indeed, unto you do we give thanks.

verses.ln1: Those who call upon your Name
verses.ln2: declare your wondrous works.

verses.ln1: “Surely at the time which I appoint,
verses.ln2: I, the Lord, will judge according to what is right.

verses.ln1: The earth shakes with fear, and all that dwell therein;
verses.ln2: but I, even I, have made firm its pillars.

verses.ln1: I say to the proud, ‘You should not boast!’
verses.ln2: And to the ungodly, ‘Do not lift up your horn!

verses.ln1: Do not lift up your horn on high,
verses.ln2: nor speak with a stiff neck.’”

verses.ln1: For help comes neither from the east nor from the west,
verses.ln2: nor yet from the wilderness or the mountains.

verses.ln1: For it is God who is the Judge;
verses.ln2: he puts down one and lifts up another.

verses.ln1: For in the hand of the Lord there is a cup, and the wine is foaming;
verses.ln2: it is fully mixed, and he pours it out.

verses.ln1: As for the dregs of it,
verses.ln2: all the ungodly of the earth shall drink them and drain them out.

verses.ln1: But I will magnify the God of Jacob
verses.ln2: and praise him for ever and ever.

verses.ln1: All the horns of the ungodly will I break,
verses.ln2: but the horns of the righteous shall be exalted.

verses.ln1: In Judah God is known;
verses.ln2: his Name is great in Israel.

verses.ln1: At Salem is his tabernacle,
verses.ln2: and his dwelling is in Zion.

verses.ln1: There he broke the arrows of the bow,
verses.ln2: the shield, the sword, and the weapons of battle.

verses.ln1: You are of more honor and might
verses.ln2: than the everlasting hills.

verses.ln1: The strong of heart have been despoiled; they have slept their sleep;
verses.ln2: and all those whose hands were mighty have lost their strength.

verses.ln1: At your rebuke, O God of Jacob,
verses.ln2: both the chariot and horse lie stunned upon the ground.

verses.ln1: You, even you, are to be feared,
verses.ln2: and who may stand in your sight when you are angry?

verses.ln1: You caused your judgment to be heard from heaven;
verses.ln2: the earth trembled and was silent,

verses.ln1: When God arose to judgment
verses.ln2: and to help all the meek upon earth.

verses.ln1: The wrath of man shall be turned to your praise,
verses.ln2: and the remnant of fierceness you shall restrain.

verses.ln1: Make a vow unto the Lord your God and keep it, all you who are round about him;
verses.ln2: bring gifts unto him who is worthy to be feared.

verses.ln1: He restrains the spirit of princes,
verses.ln2: and is feared among the kings of the earth.

verses.ln1: I will cry unto God with my voice;
verses.ln2: even unto God will I cry with my voice, and he shall hearken unto me.

verses.ln1: In the time of my trouble I sought the Lord;
verses.ln2: my hands were stretched out in the night without rest; my soul refused comfort.

verses.ln1: When I think upon God, I groan;
verses.ln2: when I ponder, my spirit grows faint.

verses.ln1: You hold my eyelids open;
verses.ln2: I am so troubled that I cannot speak.

verses.ln1: I consider the days of old;
verses.ln2: I call to remembrance the years that are past.

verses.ln1: In the night I commune with my own heart;
verses.ln2: I meditate and search my spirit.

verses.ln1: Will the Lord cast me off for ever,
verses.ln2: and will he no more show his favor?

verses.ln1: Is his mercy gone for ever,
verses.ln2: and has his promise come utterly to an end for evermore?

verses.ln1: Has God forgotten to be gracious,
verses.ln2: and will he withhold his loving-kindness in displeasure?

verses.ln1: And I said, “Has his right hand become weak?
verses.ln2: Has the hand of the Most High lost its strength?”

verses.ln1: I will remember the works of the Lord,
verses.ln2: and call to mind your wonders of old time.

verses.ln1: I will think also of all your works,
verses.ln2: and my talk shall be of your deeds.

verses.ln1: Your way, O God, is holy;
verses.ln2: who is so great a God as our God?

verses.ln1: You are the God who does wonders,
verses.ln2: and have declared your power among the peoples.

verses.ln1: You have mightily delivered your people,
verses.ln2: even the sons of Jacob and Joseph.

verses.ln1: The waters saw you, O God; the waters saw you and were afraid;
verses.ln2: the depths also were troubled.

verses.ln1: The clouds poured out water, the skies thundered,
verses.ln2: and your arrows flashed on every side.

verses.ln1: The voice of your thunder was heard in the whirlwind; the lightning lit up the world;
verses.ln2: the earth was moved and shook.

verses.ln1: Your way was in the sea, and your paths in the great waters,
verses.ln2: yet your footsteps were not seen.

verses.ln1: You led your people like sheep
verses.ln2: by the hand of Moses and Aaron.

verses.ln1: Hear my teaching, O my people;
verses.ln2: incline your ears to the words of my mouth.

verses.ln1: I will open my mouth in a parable;
verses.ln2: I will utter dark sayings of old,

verses.ln1: Which we have heard and known,
verses.ln2: and such as our forefathers have told us,

verses.ln1: That we should not hide them from the children of the generations to come,
verses.ln2: but show the honor of the Lord, his mighty and wonderful works that he has done.

verses.ln1: He made a covenant with Jacob, and gave Israel a law,
verses.ln2: which he commanded our forefathers to teach their children,

verses.ln1: That their posterity might know it,
verses.ln2: and the children which were yet unborn;

verses.ln1: With the intent that when they came up
verses.ln2: they might show it to their children,

verses.ln1: That they might put their trust in God,
verses.ln2: and not forget the works of God, but keep his commandments;

verses.ln1: And not be as their forefathers, a faithless and stubborn generation,
verses.ln2: a generation that did not set their heart aright, and whose spirit did not cleave steadfastly to God,

verses.ln1: Like the children of Ephraim, archers carrying bows,
verses.ln2: who turned back in the day of battle.

verses.ln1: They did not keep the covenant of God,
verses.ln2: and would not walk in his law,

verses.ln1: But forgot what he had done,
verses.ln2: and the wonderful works that he had shown them.

verses.ln1: Marvelous things he did in the sight of our forefathers,
verses.ln2: in the land of Egypt, even in the field of Zoan.

verses.ln1: He divided the sea and let them go through;
verses.ln2: he made the waters to stand in a heap.

verses.ln1: In the daytime he led them with a cloud,
verses.ln2: and all the night through with a light of fire.

verses.ln1: He split the hard rocks in the wilderness
verses.ln2: and gave them drink in abundance, as out of the great deep.

verses.ln1: He brought waters out of the stony rock,
verses.ln2: so that it gushed out like the rivers.

verses.ln1: Yet for all this they sinned more against him,
verses.ln2: and provoked the Most High in the wilderness.

verses.ln1: They tested God in their hearts
verses.ln2: and demanded food for their craving.

verses.ln1: They spoke against God, saying,
verses.ln2: “Can God prepare a table in the wilderness?

verses.ln1: Indeed, he smote the stony rock, so that water gushed out, and the streams overflowed;
verses.ln2: but can he give bread also, or provide meat for his people?”

verses.ln1: When the Lord heard this, he was full of wrath;
verses.ln2: so a fire was kindled against Jacob, and there flared up fierce anger against Israel,

verses.ln1: Because they did not believe in God,
verses.ln2: and did not put their trust in his help.

verses.ln1: So he commanded the clouds above
verses.ln2: and opened the doors of heaven.

verses.ln1: He rained down manna upon them to eat
verses.ln2: and gave them food from heaven.

verses.ln1: So mortals ate the bread of angels;
verses.ln2: for he sent them food enough.

verses.ln1: He caused the east wind to blow in the heavens,
verses.ln2: and through his power he brought in the south wind.

verses.ln1: He rained meat upon them as thick as dust
verses.ln2: and feathered fowl like the sand of the sea.

verses.ln1: He let it fall among their tents,
verses.ln2: even round about their habitations.

verses.ln1: So they ate and were well filled, for he gave them what they desired;
verses.ln2: they did not deny themselves their cravings,

verses.ln1: But while the food was yet in their mouths, the heavy wrath of God came upon them, and slew the mightiest of them,
verses.ln2: and struck down the young men of Israel.

verses.ln1: But for all this they sinned yet more,
verses.ln2: and did not believe his wondrous works.

verses.ln1: Therefore he brought their days to an end in vanity
verses.ln2: and their years in trouble.

verses.ln1: When he slew them, they sought him,
verses.ln2: and returned, and inquired after God.

verses.ln1: And they remembered that God was their rock,
verses.ln2: and the Most High God was their redeemer.

verses.ln1: Nevertheless, they flattered him with their mouth
verses.ln2: and spoke deceitfully to him with their tongue.

verses.ln1: For their heart was not fixed on him,
verses.ln2: neither did they continue steadfast in his covenant.

verses.ln1: But he was so merciful that he forgave their iniquities
verses.ln2: and did not destroy them.

verses.ln1: Indeed, many times he turned his wrath away
verses.ln2: and would not permit his displeasure to arise.

verses.ln1: For he considered that they were but flesh,
verses.ln2: that they were even as the wind that passes away and comes not again.

verses.ln1: Many times they provoked him in the wilderness
verses.ln2: and grieved him in the desert.

verses.ln1: They turned back, and tested God,
verses.ln2: and provoked the Holy One of Israel.

verses.ln1: They remembered not his power,
verses.ln2: nor the day when he delivered them from the hand of the enemy,

verses.ln1: How he had wrought his miracles in Egypt
verses.ln2: and his wonders in the field of Zoan.

verses.ln1: He turned their waters into blood,
verses.ln2: so that they might not drink of the rivers.

verses.ln1: He sent flies among them, which devoured them up,
verses.ln2: and frogs to destroy them.

verses.ln1: He gave their fruit to the grasshopper
verses.ln2: and their labor to the locust.

verses.ln1: He destroyed their vines with hailstones
verses.ln2: and their sycamore trees with the frost.

verses.ln1: He smote their cattle also with hailstones
verses.ln2: and their flocks with hot thunderbolts.

verses.ln1: He cast upon them the furiousness of his wrath, anger, displeasure, and trouble,
verses.ln2: sending these destroying angels among them.

verses.ln1: He made a way for his indignation, and did not spare their soul from death,
verses.ln2: but gave their life over to the pestilence,

verses.ln1: And smote all the firstborn in Egypt,
verses.ln2: the firstfruits of their strength in the dwellings of Ham.

verses.ln1: But as for his own people, he led them forth like sheep
verses.ln2: and carried them in the wilderness like a flock.

verses.ln1: He brought them out safely, and they were not afraid;
verses.ln2: he overwhelmed their enemies with the sea,

verses.ln1: And brought them within the borders of his holy land,
verses.ln2: to his mountain which he obtained with his right hand.

verses.ln1: He cast out the nations before them,
verses.ln2: and caused their land to be divided among them for an inheritance, and made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents.

verses.ln1: But they tested and displeased the Most High God,
verses.ln2: and did not keep his testimonies,

verses.ln1: But turned their backs and fell away like their forefathers,
verses.ln2: twisting aside like a broken bow.

verses.ln1: For they grieved him with their hill altars
verses.ln2: and provoked him to displeasure with their images.

verses.ln1: When God heard this, he was full of wrath
verses.ln2: and utterly rejected Israel,

verses.ln1: So that he forsook the tabernacle in Shiloh,
verses.ln2: even the tent that he had pitched among them.

verses.ln1: He delivered the ark into captivity,
verses.ln2: and his glory into the enemy’s hand.

verses.ln1: He gave his people over to the sword
verses.ln2: and was angry with his inheritance.

verses.ln1: Fire consumed their young men,
verses.ln2: and their maidens had no marriage songs.

verses.ln1: Their priests were slain with the sword,
verses.ln2: and their widows made no lamentation.

verses.ln1: Then the Lord awakened as one out of sleep,
verses.ln2: and like a warrior recovered from wine.

verses.ln1: He drove his enemies backward
verses.ln2: and put them to a perpetual shame.

verses.ln1: He rejected the tabernacle of Joseph
verses.ln2: and did not choose the tribe of Ephraim,

verses.ln1: But chose the tribe of Judah,
verses.ln2: even the hill of Zion which he loved.

verses.ln1: And there he built his sanctuary, like the heights of heaven,
verses.ln2: like the earth which he had established for ever.

verses.ln1: He chose David his servant,
verses.ln2: and took him away from the sheepfolds;

verses.ln1: As he was following the ewes that were great with young, God took him,
verses.ln2: that he might feed Jacob his people, and Israel his inheritance.

verses.ln1: So he fed them with a faithful and true heart,
verses.ln2: and guided them with skillful hands.

verses.ln1: O God, the nations have come into your inheritance;
verses.ln2: they have defiled your holy temple, and made Jerusalem a heap of stones.

verses.ln1: The dead bodies of your servants have they given to be meat for the birds of the air,
verses.ln2: and the flesh of your saints to the beasts of the land.

verses.ln1: Their blood have they shed like water on every side of Jerusalem,
verses.ln2: and there was no one to bury them.

verses.ln1: We have become a reproach to our enemies,
verses.ln2: an object of scorn and derision to those who are round about us.

verses.ln1: O Lord, how long will you be angry?
verses.ln2: Shall your jealousy burn like fire for ever?

verses.ln1: Pour out your indignation upon the nations that have not known you,
verses.ln2: and upon the kingdoms that have not called upon your Name.

verses.ln1: For they have devoured Jacob
verses.ln2: and laid waste his dwelling place.

verses.ln1: O remember not our past sins, but have mercy on us speedily,
verses.ln2: for we have come to great misery.

verses.ln1: Help us, O God of our salvation, for the glory of your Name;
verses.ln2: O deliver us and forgive our sins for your Name’s sake.

verses.ln1: Why do the nations say,
verses.ln2: “Where now is their God?”

verses.ln1: O let the vengeance of your servants’ blood that is shed
verses.ln2: be known in our sight among the nations.

verses.ln1: O let the sorrowful sighing of the prisoners come before you;
verses.ln2: according to the greatness of your power, preserve those who are condemned to die.

verses.ln1: As for the blasphemy by which our neighbors have blasphemed you,
verses.ln2: repay them, O Lord, seven-fold into their bosoms.

verses.ln1: So we, who are your people and the sheep of your pasture, shall give you thanks for ever,
verses.ln2: and will always be showing forth your praise from generation to generation.

verses.ln1: Hear, O Shepherd of Israel, you that lead Joseph like a sheep;
verses.ln2: show yourself also, you that sit upon the cherubim.

verses.ln1: Before Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh,
verses.ln2: stir up your strength and come to help us.

verses.ln1: Restore us again, O God;
verses.ln2: show the light of your countenance, and we shall be whole.

verses.ln1: O Lord God of hosts,
verses.ln2: how long will you be angry with your people that pray?

verses.ln1: You feed them with the bread of tears
verses.ln2: and give them plenteous tears to drink.

verses.ln1: You have made us the derision of our neighbors,
verses.ln2: and our enemies laugh us to scorn.

verses.ln1: Restore us again, O God of hosts;
verses.ln2: show the light of your countenance, and we shall be whole.

verses.ln1: You have brought a vine out of Egypt;
verses.ln2: you have cast out the nations and planted it.

verses.ln1: You made room for it,
verses.ln2: and when it had taken root, it filled the land.

verses.ln1: The hills were covered with the shadow of it,
verses.ln2: and the boughs thereof were like the mighty cedar trees.

verses.ln1: It stretched out its branches to the sea
verses.ln2: and its boughs to the river.

verses.ln1: Why have you broken down its hedge,
verses.ln2: so that all those who go by pluck off its grapes?

verses.ln1: The wild boar out of the wood roots it up,
verses.ln2: and the wild beasts of the field devour it.

verses.ln1: Turn again, O God of hosts, look down from heaven;
verses.ln2: behold, and visit this vine,

verses.ln1: And the place of the vineyard that your right hand has planted,
verses.ln2: and the branch that you made so strong for yourself.

verses.ln1: As for those who burn it with fire and cut it down,
verses.ln2: let them perish at the rebuke of your countenance.

verses.ln1: Let your hand be upon the man of your right hand
verses.ln2: and upon the son of man, whom you made so strong for yourself.

verses.ln1: And so we will not turn back from you;
verses.ln2: O let us live, and we shall call upon your Name.

verses.ln1: Restore us again, O Lord God of hosts;
verses.ln2: show the light of your countenance, and we shall be whole.

verses.ln1: O sing merrily unto God our strength;
verses.ln2: make a cheerful noise unto the God of Jacob.

verses.ln1: Take the psalm, bring hither the timbrel,
verses.ln2: the merry harp with the lute.

verses.ln1: Blow the trumpet at the new moon,
verses.ln2: even in the time appointed, and on our solemn feast day.

verses.ln1: For this was made a statute for Israel
verses.ln2: and a law of the God of Jacob.

verses.ln1: This he laid upon Joseph for a testimony,
verses.ln2: when he came out of the land of Egypt.

verses.ln1: “I eased his shoulder from the burden,
verses.ln2: and his hands were delivered from bearing the load.

verses.ln1: You called upon me in troubles, and I delivered you,
verses.ln2: and I answered you in the thundercloud and tested you at the waters of strife.

verses.ln1: Hear, O my people, and I will admonish you;
verses.ln2: O Israel, if you will hearken unto me,

verses.ln1: There shall be no strange god among you,
verses.ln2: neither shall you worship any other god.

verses.ln1: I am the Lord your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt;
verses.ln2: open your mouth wide, and I shall fill it.

verses.ln1: But my people would not hear my voice,
verses.ln2: and Israel would not obey me.

verses.ln1: So I gave them up to the stubbornness of their hearts,
verses.ln2: and let them follow their own imaginations.

verses.ln1: Oh, that my people would have hearkened unto me,
verses.ln2: that Israel had walked in my ways.
