verses.ln1: I would soon have put down their enemies
verses.ln2: and turned my hand against their adversaries.

verses.ln1: The haters of the Lord would humble themselves before him,
verses.ln2: and their time of punishment would endure for ever.

verses.ln1: But Israel would I feed with the finest wheat-flour,
verses.ln2: and with honey out of the stony rock would I satisfy him.”

verses.ln1: God stands in the council of princes;
verses.ln2: he is a Judge among gods.

verses.ln1: “How long will you give wrong judgment
verses.ln2: and accept the ungodly?

verses.ln1: Defend the poor and fatherless;
verses.ln2: see that those who are in need and necessity have what is right.

verses.ln1: Deliver the outcast and poor;
verses.ln2: save them from the hand of the ungodly.”

verses.ln1: They will not learn nor understand, but walk about in darkness;
verses.ln2: all the foundations of the earth are shaken.

verses.ln1: I have said, “You are gods,
verses.ln2: and you are all the children of the Most High;

verses.ln1: But you shall die like mortals,
verses.ln2: and fall like one of the princes.”

verses.ln1: Arise, O God, and judge the earth,
verses.ln2: for you shall take all nations for your inheritance.

verses.ln1: Hold not your tongue, O God; keep not silent,
verses.ln2: but rouse yourself, O God.

verses.ln1: For behold, your enemies murmur,
verses.ln2: and those who hate you have lifted up their head.

verses.ln1: They have conspired secretly against your people
verses.ln2: and taken counsel against your cherished ones.

verses.ln1: They have said, “Come, and let us wipe them out, that they may be no more a people,
verses.ln2: and that the name of Israel may be remembered no more.”

verses.ln1: For they have brought their heads together with one consent
verses.ln2: and are aligned against you:

verses.ln1: The tents of the Edomites and the Ishmaelites,
verses.ln2: the Moabites and Hagarenes,

verses.ln1: Gebal, and Ammon, and Amalek,
verses.ln2: the Philistines with those who dwell at Tyre.

verses.ln1: Assyria also has joined with them,
verses.ln2: and has helped the children of Lot.

verses.ln1: But do to them as you did to the Midianites,
verses.ln2: to Sisera and to Jabin at the brook of Kishon,

verses.ln1: Who perished at Endor
verses.ln2: and became as dung on the earth.

verses.ln1: Make their princes like Oreb and Zeëb;
verses.ln2: indeed, make all their princes like Zebah and Zalmunna,

verses.ln1: Who said, “Let us take for ourselves
verses.ln2: the pastures of God as our possession.”

verses.ln1: O my God, make them like whirling dust
verses.ln2: and like stubble before the wind,

verses.ln1: Like the fire that burns up the woods
verses.ln2: and like the flame that consumes the mountains.

verses.ln1: Pursue them even with your tempest,
verses.ln2: and make them afraid with your storm.

verses.ln1: Cover their faces with shame, O Lord,
verses.ln2: that they may seek your Name.

verses.ln1: Let them be disgraced and dismayed ever more and more;
verses.ln2: let them be put to shame and perish.

verses.ln1: And they shall know that you, whose Name is the Lord,
verses.ln2: are alone the Most High over all the earth.

verses.ln1: How lovely are your dwellings,
verses.ln2: O Lord God of hosts!

verses.ln1: My soul has a desire and longing to enter into the courts of the Lord;
verses.ln2: my heart and my flesh rejoice in the living God.

verses.ln1: Indeed, the sparrow has found her a house, and the swallow a nest where she may lay her young,
verses.ln2: even your altars, O Lord of hosts, my King and my God.

verses.ln1: Blessed are they who dwell in your house;
verses.ln2: they will be always praising you.

verses.ln1: Blessed is the one whose strength is in you,
verses.ln2: in whose heart are your ways,

verses.ln1: Who going through the valley of misery uses it for a well;
verses.ln2: indeed, the early rains fill the pools with water.

verses.ln1: They will go from strength to strength,
verses.ln2: and the God of gods shall be seen by them in Zion.

verses.ln1: O Lord God of hosts, hear my prayer;
verses.ln2: hearken, O God of Jacob.

verses.ln1: Behold, O God, our defender,
verses.ln2: and look upon the face of your Anointed.

verses.ln1: For one day in your courts
verses.ln2: is better than a thousand;

verses.ln1: I would rather be a door-keeper in the house of my God
verses.ln2: than dwell in the tents of ungodliness.

verses.ln1: For the Lord God is a light and defense;
verses.ln2: the Lord will give grace and honor, and no good thing shall he withhold from those who live a godly life.

verses.ln1: O Lord God of hosts,
verses.ln2: blessed is the one who puts his trust in you.

verses.ln1: Lord, you have been gracious to your land;
verses.ln2: you have turned away the captivity of Jacob.

verses.ln1: You have forgiven the offence of your people
verses.ln2: and covered all their sins.

verses.ln1: You have taken away all your displeasure
verses.ln2: and turned yourself from your wrathful indignation.

verses.ln1: Restore us then, O God our Savior,
verses.ln2: and let your anger cease from us.

verses.ln1: Will you be displeased at us for ever,
verses.ln2: and will you stretch out your wrath from one generation to another?

verses.ln1: Will you not turn again and quicken us,
verses.ln2: that your people may rejoice in you?

verses.ln1: Show us your mercy, O Lord,
verses.ln2: and grant us your salvation.

verses.ln1: I will hearken to what the Lord God will say,
verses.ln2: for he shall speak peace unto his people, and to his saints, that they turn not again.

verses.ln1: For his salvation is near to those who fear him,
verses.ln2: that glory may dwell in our land.

verses.ln1: Mercy and truth have met together;
verses.ln2: righteousness and peace have kissed each other.

verses.ln1: Truth shall flourish out of the earth,
verses.ln2: and righteousness shall look down from heaven.

verses.ln1: Indeed, the Lord shall show goodness,
verses.ln2: and our land shall give its increase.

verses.ln1: Righteousness shall go before him,
verses.ln2: and he shall direct his going in the way.

verses.ln1: Bow down your ear, O Lord, and hear me,
verses.ln2: for I am poor and in misery.

verses.ln1: Preserve my life, for I am faithful;
verses.ln2: my God, save your servant who puts his trust in you.

verses.ln1: Be merciful unto me, O Lord,
verses.ln2: for I will call daily upon you.

verses.ln1: Comfort the soul of your servant,
verses.ln2: for to you, O Lord, do I lift up my soul.

verses.ln1: For you, Lord, are good and gracious,
verses.ln2: and of great mercy to all those who call upon you.

verses.ln1: Give ear, Lord, unto my prayer,
verses.ln2: and attend to the voice of my humble supplications.

verses.ln1: In the time of my trouble I will call upon you,
verses.ln2: for you answer me when I call.

verses.ln1: Among the gods there is none like you, O Lord,
verses.ln2: nor are there any deeds like yours.

verses.ln1: All nations that you have made shall come and worship you, O Lord,
verses.ln2: and shall glorify your Name.

verses.ln1: For you are great and do wondrous things;
verses.ln2: indeed, you are God alone.

verses.ln1: Teach me your way, O Lord, and I will walk in your truth;
verses.ln2: O knit my heart to you, that I may fear your Name.

verses.ln1: I will thank you, O Lord my God, with all my heart,
verses.ln2: and will praise your Name for evermore.

verses.ln1: For great is your mercy toward me;
verses.ln2: you have delivered my life from the nethermost Pit.

verses.ln1: O God, the proud have risen up against me,
verses.ln2: and the company of violent men have sought after my life, and have not set you before their eyes.

verses.ln1: But you, O Lord God, are full of compassion and mercy,
verses.ln2: long-suffering, plenteous in goodness and truth.

verses.ln1: O turn then unto me, and have mercy upon me;
verses.ln2: give your strength unto your servant, and help the son of your handmaid.

verses.ln1: Show me some token of your favor, that those who hate me may see it and be ashamed,
verses.ln2: because you, Lord, have been my helper and comforter.

verses.ln1: The Lord loves the foundation which he has laid upon the holy hills;
verses.ln2: the gates of Zion are dearer to him than all the dwellings of Jacob.

verses.ln1: Very excellent things are spoken of you,
verses.ln2: O city of God.

verses.ln1: I will consider Egypt and Babylon
verses.ln2: among those who know me.

verses.ln1: Behold Philistia also, and Tyre, with Ethiopia;
verses.ln2: each one was born in her.

verses.ln1: And of Zion it shall be reported that each one was born in her,
verses.ln2: and the Most High shall establish her.

verses.ln1: The Lord shall record it when he registers the people,
verses.ln2: that each one was born there.

verses.ln1: The singers and the dancers also shall say,
verses.ln2: “All my fresh springs are in you.”

verses.ln1: O Lord God of my salvation, I have cried day and night before you;
verses.ln2: O let my prayer enter into your presence; incline your ear to my call.

verses.ln1: For my soul is full of trouble,
verses.ln2: and my life draws nigh to the Grave.

verses.ln1: I am counted as one of those who go down into the pit,
verses.ln2: and I have become as one who has no strength.

verses.ln1: I have become like the dead, and like the slain who lie in the grave,
verses.ln2: whom you remember no more, and who are cut off from your hand.

verses.ln1: You have laid me in the lowest pit,
verses.ln2: in a place of darkness, and in the deep.

verses.ln1: Your indignation lies heavy upon me,
verses.ln2: and you have overwhelmed me with all your storms.

verses.ln1: You have put my friends far from me,
verses.ln2: and made me to be abhorred by them.

verses.ln1: I am in prison;
verses.ln2: I cannot go forth.

verses.ln1: My sight fails because of trouble;
verses.ln2: Lord, I have called daily upon you; I have stretched forth my hands unto you.

verses.ln1: Do you show wonders among the dead,
verses.ln2: or shall the dead rise up again and praise you?

verses.ln1: Shall your loving-kindness be shown in the grave,
verses.ln2: or your faithfulness in destruction?

verses.ln1: Shall your wondrous works be known in the dark,
verses.ln2: and your righteousness in the land where all things are forgotten?

verses.ln1: Unto you have I cried, O Lord,
verses.ln2: and early shall my prayer come before you.

verses.ln1: Lord, why do you cast off my soul
verses.ln2: and hide your face from me?

verses.ln1: I am in misery, like one who is at the point of death;
verses.ln2: even from my youth, your terrors have I suffered with a troubled mind.

verses.ln1: Your wrathful displeasure goes over me,
verses.ln2: and the fear of you has undone me.

verses.ln1: Daily they come round about me like water,
verses.ln2: and encompass me on every side.

verses.ln1: My companions and neighbors you have put away from me,
verses.ln2: and hidden my friends out of my sight.

verses.ln1: My song shall be always of the loving-kindness of the Lord;
verses.ln2: with my mouth will I ever be proclaiming your faithfulness, from one generation to another.

verses.ln1: For I have said, “Mercy shall be built up for ever;
verses.ln2: your faithfulness shall be established in the heavens.”

verses.ln1: I have made a covenant with my chosen one;
verses.ln2: I have sworn to David my servant:

verses.ln1: “Your seed will I establish for ever,
verses.ln2: and set up your throne from one generation to another.”

verses.ln1: O Lord, the heavens will praise your wondrous works
verses.ln2: and your faithfulness in the assembly of the saints.

verses.ln1: For who in the clouds can be compared unto the Lord?
verses.ln2: And who among the gods is like unto the Lord?

verses.ln1: God is greatly to be feared in the council of the saints,
verses.ln2: and to be held in reverence by all those who are round about him.

verses.ln1: O Lord God of hosts, who is like you?
verses.ln2: Your faithfulness, most mighty Lord, is round about you.

verses.ln1: You rule the raging of the sea;
verses.ln2: you still the waves when they arise.

verses.ln1: You have subdued Rahab of the deep, and destroyed her;
verses.ln2: you have scattered your enemies with your mighty arm.

verses.ln1: The heavens are yours; the earth also is yours;
verses.ln2: you laid the foundation of the world, and all that is in it.

verses.ln1: You have made the north and the south;
verses.ln2: Tabor and Hermon shall rejoice in your Name.

verses.ln1: You have a mighty arm;
verses.ln2: strong is your hand, and high is your right hand.

verses.ln1: Righteousness and justice are the foundation of your throne;
verses.ln2: mercy and truth shall go before your face.

verses.ln1: Blessed are the people, O Lord, who rejoice in you;
verses.ln2: they shall walk in the light of your countenance.

verses.ln1: Their delight shall be in your Name all the day long,
verses.ln2: and in your righteousness shall they make their boast.

verses.ln1: For you are the glory of their strength,
verses.ln2: and by your favor you shall lift up our might.

verses.ln1: For the Lord is our defense;
verses.ln2: the Holy One of Israel is our King.

verses.ln1: You spoke in a vision to your saints, and said,
verses.ln2: “I have set the crown upon one who is mighty; I have exalted one chosen out of the people.

verses.ln1: I have found David my servant;
verses.ln2: with my holy oil have I anointed him.

verses.ln1: My hand shall hold him fast,
verses.ln2: and my arm shall strengthen him.

verses.ln1: The enemy shall not be able to do him violence;
verses.ln2: the son of wickedness shall not hurt him.

verses.ln1: I will smite his foes before his face
verses.ln2: and strike down those who hate him.

verses.ln1: My faithfulness and my mercy shall be with him,
verses.ln2: and in my Name shall his horn be exalted.

verses.ln1: I will give him dominion over the sea,
verses.ln2: and with his right hand shall he rule the rivers.

verses.ln1: He shall say to me, “You are my Father,
verses.ln2: my God, and the rock of my salvation.”

verses.ln1: And I will make him my firstborn,
verses.ln2: higher than the kings of the earth.

verses.ln1: My mercy will I keep for him for ever,
verses.ln2: and my covenant shall stand fast with him.

verses.ln1: His seed will I make to endure for ever
verses.ln2: and his throne as the days of heaven.

verses.ln1: But if his children forsake my law,
verses.ln2: and do not walk in my judgments,

verses.ln1: If they break my statutes and do not keep my commandments,*
verses.ln2: I will punish their offenses with the rod, and their sin with scourges.

verses.ln1: Nevertheless, my loving-kindness I will not utterly take from him,
verses.ln2: nor suffer my faithfulness to fail.

verses.ln1: My covenant I will not break,
verses.ln2: nor alter the word that has gone out of my lips.

verses.ln1: I have sworn once by my holiness
verses.ln2: that I will not fail David.

verses.ln1: His seed shall endure for ever
verses.ln2: and his throne as the sun before me.

verses.ln1: It shall endure for evermore as the moon,
verses.ln2: and as the faithful witness in the heavens.

verses.ln1: But you have rejected and forsaken your Anointed;
verses.ln2: you are full of wrath against him.

verses.ln1: You have broken the covenant with your servant;
verses.ln2: you have defiled his crown and cast it to the ground.

verses.ln1: You have overthrown all his walls
verses.ln2: and broken down his strongholds.

verses.ln1: All those who go by plunder him,
verses.ln2: and he has become a reproach to his neighbors.

verses.ln1: You have exalted the right hand of his enemies,
verses.ln2: and made all his adversaries rejoice.

verses.ln1: You have turned back the edge of his sword
verses.ln2: and have not given him victory in the battle.

verses.ln1: You have taken away his glory
verses.ln2: and cast his throne down to the ground.

verses.ln1: The days of his youth you have shortened
verses.ln2: and covered him with dishonor.

verses.ln1: Lord, how long will you utterly hide yourself ?
verses.ln2: How long shall your wrath burn like fire?

verses.ln1: O remember how short my time is;
verses.ln2: why have you made all people for nought?

verses.ln1: What man is there who lives and shall not see death,
verses.ln2: and shall deliver his soul from the power of the Grave?

verses.ln1: Lord, where are your loving-kindnesses of old,
verses.ln2: which you swore to David in your faithfulness?

verses.ln1: Remember, Lord, how your servants are reproached,
verses.ln2: and how I bear in my bosom the rebukes of many people;

verses.ln1: Remember how your enemies have reproached you, O Lord,
verses.ln2: how they have called after your Anointed King with cries of scorn.

verses.ln1: Praised be the Lord for evermore.
verses.ln2: Amen and Amen.

verses.ln1: Lord, you have been our refuge
verses.ln2: from one generation to another.

verses.ln1: Before the mountains were brought forth, or the earth and the world were made,
verses.ln2: you are God from everlasting, and world without end.

verses.ln1: You turn man back to the dust;
verses.ln2: you say, “Return, O children of men.”

verses.ln1: For a thousand years in your sight are as yesterday,
verses.ln2: even as a day that is past.

verses.ln1: You scatter them as a night-watch that comes quickly to an end;
verses.ln2: they are even as a dream and fade away.

verses.ln1: They are like the grass, which in the morning is green,
verses.ln2: but in the evening is dried up and withered.

verses.ln1: For we consume away in your displeasure
verses.ln2: and are afraid at your wrathful indignation.

verses.ln1: You have set our misdeeds before you,
verses.ln2: and our secret sins in the light of your countenance.

verses.ln1: For when you are angry, all our days are gone;
verses.ln2: we bring our years to an end, as a tale that is told.

verses.ln1: The days of our life are seventy years, and though some be so strong that they come to eighty years,
verses.ln2: yet is their span but labor and sorrow; so soon it passes away, and we are gone.

verses.ln1: But who regards the power of your wrath,
verses.ln2: and who considers the fierceness of your anger?

verses.ln1: So teach us to number our days,
verses.ln2: that we may apply our hearts unto wisdom.

verses.ln1: Turn again, O Lord, and tarry not;
verses.ln2: be gracious unto your servants.

verses.ln1: O satisfy us with your mercy in the morning;
verses.ln2: so shall we rejoice and be glad all the days of our life.

verses.ln1: Comfort us again, according to the measure of the days that you have afflicted us,
verses.ln2: and for the years in which we have suffered adversity.

verses.ln1: Show your servants your work
verses.ln2: and their children your glory.

verses.ln1: And may the grace of the Lord our God be upon us;
verses.ln2: prosper the work of our hands; O prosper our handiwork.

verses.ln1: Whoever dwells under the defense of the Most High
verses.ln2: shall abide under the shadow of the Almighty.

verses.ln1: I will say unto the Lord, “You are my refuge and my stronghold,
verses.ln2: my God in whom I will trust.”

verses.ln1: For he shall deliver you from the snare of the hunter
verses.ln2: and from the deadly pestilence.

verses.ln1: He shall defend you under his wings, and you shall be safe
verses.ln2: under his feathers;

verses.ln1: his faithfulness and truth shall be your shield and buckler. You shall not be afraid of any terror by night,
verses.ln2: nor of the arrow that flies by day,

verses.ln1: Of the pestilence that walks in darkness,
verses.ln2: nor of the sickness that destroys at noonday.

verses.ln1: A thousand shall fall beside you, and ten thousand at your right hand,
verses.ln2: but it shall not come near you.

verses.ln1: Indeed, with your eyes you shall behold
verses.ln2: and see the reward of the ungodly.

verses.ln1: Because you have said, “The Lord is my refuge,”
verses.ln2: and have made the Most High your stronghold,

verses.ln1: There shall no evil happen to you,
verses.ln2: neither shall any plague come near your dwelling.

verses.ln1: For he shall give his angels charge over you,
verses.ln2: to keep you in all your ways.

verses.ln1: They shall bear you in their hands,
verses.ln2: that you hurt not your foot against a stone.

verses.ln1: You shall tread upon the lion and adder;
verses.ln2: the young lion and the serpent you shall trample under your feet.

verses.ln1: “Because he has set his love upon me, therefore I will deliver him;
verses.ln2: I will lift him up, because he has known my Name.

verses.ln1: He shall call upon me, and I will hear him;
verses.ln2: indeed, I am with him in trouble; I will deliver him and bring him honor.

verses.ln1: With long life I will satisfy him,
verses.ln2: and show him my salvation.”

verses.ln1: It is a good thing to give thanks unto the Lord,
verses.ln2: and to sing praises unto your Name, O Most High,

verses.ln1: To tell of your loving-kindness early in the morning,
verses.ln2: and of your faithfulness in the night season,

verses.ln1: Upon an instrument of ten strings and upon the lute,
verses.ln2: with the sound of melody upon the harp.

verses.ln1: For you, Lord, have made me glad by your deeds,
verses.ln2: and I will shout for joy because of your handiwork.

verses.ln1: O Lord, how glorious are your works;
verses.ln2: your thoughts are very deep.

verses.ln1: The dull of heart does not consider this,
verses.ln2: and a fool does not understand it:

verses.ln1: Though the ungodly are as green as the grass, and though all the workers of wickedness flourish,
verses.ln2: they shall be destroyed for ever; but you, Lord, are the Most High for evermore.

verses.ln1: For lo, your enemies, O Lord, lo, your enemies shall perish,
verses.ln2: and all the workers of wickedness shall be destroyed.

verses.ln1: But my horn shall be exalted like the horns of wild bulls;
verses.ln2: for I am anointed with fresh oil.

verses.ln1: My eye also shall see its desire upon my enemies,
verses.ln2: and my ear shall hear with joy the end of the wicked who rise up against me.

verses.ln1: The righteous shall flourish like a palm tree,
verses.ln2: and shall spread abroad like a cedar in Lebanon.

verses.ln1: Those who are planted in the house of the Lord
verses.ln2: shall flourish in the courts of our God.

verses.ln1: They also shall bring forth fruit in their old age,
verses.ln2: and shall be green and full of sap,

verses.ln1: That they may show how upright the Lord is,
verses.ln2: my rock, in whom there is no unrighteousness.

verses.ln1: The Lord is King and has put on glorious apparel;
verses.ln2: the Lord has put on his apparel and girded himself with strength.

verses.ln1: He has made the round world so sure
verses.ln2: that it cannot be moved.

verses.ln1: Ever since the world began, your throne has been established;
verses.ln2: you are from everlasting.

verses.ln1: The floods have risen, O Lord; the floods have lifted up their voice;
verses.ln2: the floods have lifted up their waves.

verses.ln1: Mightier than the sound of many waters, mightier than the waves of the sea,
verses.ln2: the Lord who dwells on high is mightier.

verses.ln1: Your testimonies, O Lord, are very sure;
verses.ln2: holiness adorns your house for ever.

verses.ln1: O Lord God to whom vengeance belongs,
verses.ln2: O God to whom vengeance belongs, show yourself.

verses.ln1: Arise, O Judge of the world,
verses.ln2: and reward the proud according to their deserving.

verses.ln1: O Lord, how long shall the ungodly,
verses.ln2: how long shall the ungodly triumph?

verses.ln1: How long shall all evildoers speak so disdainfully
verses.ln2: and make such proud boasting?

verses.ln1: They smite down your people, O Lord,
verses.ln2: and trouble your heritage.

verses.ln1: They murder the widow and the stranger,
verses.ln2: and put the fatherless to death.

verses.ln1: And yet they say, “The Lord shall not see,
verses.ln2: neither shall the God of Jacob regard it.”

verses.ln1: Take heed, you unwise among the people;
verses.ln2: O you fools, when will you understand?

verses.ln1: He who planted the ear, shall he not hear?
verses.ln2: Or he who made the eye, shall he not see?

verses.ln1: Or he who nurtures the nations,
verses.ln2: he who teaches humanity knowledge, shall he not punish?

verses.ln1: The Lord knows the thoughts of man,
verses.ln2: that they are but vain.

verses.ln1: Blessed is the one whom you chasten, O Lord,
verses.ln2: and whom you teach your law,

verses.ln1: That you may give him patience in time of adversity,
verses.ln2: until a pit is dug for the ungodly.

verses.ln1: For the Lord will not fail his people,
verses.ln2: neither will he forsake his inheritance,

verses.ln1: But righteousness shall return to the place of judgment,
verses.ln2: and all those who are true of heart shall follow it.

verses.ln1: Who will rise up with me against the wicked,
verses.ln2: or who will take my part against the evildoers?

verses.ln1: If the Lord had not helped me,
verses.ln2: my soul would soon have dwelt in the land of silence.

verses.ln1: But when I said, “My foot has slipped,”
verses.ln2: your mercy, O Lord, held me up.

verses.ln1: In the multitude of the sorrows that I had in my heart,
verses.ln2: your comforts refreshed my soul.

verses.ln1: Will you have anything to do with the council of wickedness,
verses.ln2: which turns evil into law?

verses.ln1: They gather themselves together against the soul of the righteous
verses.ln2: and condemn the innocent to death.

verses.ln1: But the Lord is my refuge,
verses.ln2: and my God is the rock of my confidence.

verses.ln1: He shall recompense them for their wickedness, and destroy them in their own malice;
verses.ln2: indeed, the Lord our God shall destroy them.

verses.ln1: O come, let us sing unto the Lord;
verses.ln2: let us heartily rejoice in the strength of our salvation.

verses.ln1: Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving
verses.ln2: and show ourselves glad in him with psalms.

verses.ln1: For the Lord is a great God
verses.ln2: and a great King above all gods.

verses.ln1: In his hand are all the depths of the earth,
verses.ln2: and the heights of the hills are his also.

verses.ln1: The sea is his, for he made it,
verses.ln2: and his hands prepared the dry land.

verses.ln1: O come, let us worship and fall down,
verses.ln2: and kneel before the Lord our Maker.

verses.ln1: For he is our God,
verses.ln2: and we are the people of his pasture, and the sheep of his hand.

verses.ln1: Today, if you will hear his voice, harden not your hearts
verses.ln2: as in the provocation, and as in the day of temptation in the wilderness,

verses.ln1: When your fathers tested me,
verses.ln2: and put me to the proof, though they had seen my works.

verses.ln1: Forty years long was I grieved with this generation and said,
verses.ln2: “It is a people that err in their hearts, for they have not known my ways,”

verses.ln1: Of whom I swore in my wrath
verses.ln2: that they should not enter into my rest.

verses.ln1: O sing unto the Lord a new song;
verses.ln2: sing unto the Lord, all the whole earth.

verses.ln1: Sing unto the Lord and praise his Name;
verses.ln2: tell of his salvation from day to day.

verses.ln1: Declare his honor to the nations,
verses.ln2: and his wonders to all peoples.

verses.ln1: For the Lord is great, and highly to be praised;
verses.ln2: he is more to be feared than all gods.

verses.ln1: As for all the gods of the nations, they are but idols;
verses.ln2: but it is the Lord who made the heavens.

verses.ln1: Glory and majesty are before him;
verses.ln2: power and honor are in his sanctuary.

verses.ln1: Ascribe unto the Lord, O you families of the peoples,
verses.ln2: ascribe unto the Lord worship and power.

verses.ln1: Ascribe unto the Lord the honor due unto his Name;
verses.ln2: bring offerings and come into his courts.

verses.ln1: O worship the Lord in the beauty of holiness;
verses.ln2: let the whole earth stand in awe of him.

verses.ln1: Tell it out among the nations, “The Lord is King;
verses.ln2: it is he who has made the world so firm that it cannot be moved; he shall judge the peoples righteously.”

verses.ln1: Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad;
verses.ln2: let the sea make a noise, and all that is therein.

verses.ln1: Let the field be joyful, and all that is in it;
verses.ln2: then shall all the trees of the wood rejoice before the Lord.

verses.ln1: For he comes, for he comes to judge the earth,
verses.ln2: and with righteousness to judge the world, and the peoples with his truth.

verses.ln1: The Lord is King; let the earth be glad.
verses.ln2: Indeed, let the multitude of the isles be glad.

verses.ln1: Clouds and darkness are round about him;
verses.ln2: righteousness and judgment are the foundation of his throne.

verses.ln1: There goes a fire before him
verses.ln2: and burns up his enemies on every side.

verses.ln1: His lightnings gave light to the world;
verses.ln2: the earth saw it and was afraid.

verses.ln1: The hills melted like wax at the presence of the Lord,
verses.ln2: at the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.

verses.ln1: The heavens have declared his righteousness,
verses.ln2: and all the people have seen his glory.

verses.ln1: Confounded be all those who worship carved images, and who delight in false gods;
verses.ln2: worship him, all you gods.

verses.ln1: Zion heard of it and rejoiced,
verses.ln2: and the daughters of Judah were glad, because of your judgments, O Lord.

verses.ln1: For you, Lord, are most high over all the earth;
verses.ln2: you are exalted far above all gods.

verses.ln1: O you who love the Lord, see that you hate the thing which is evil;
verses.ln2: the Lord preserves the souls of his saints; he shall deliver them from the hand of the ungodly.

verses.ln1: A light has sprung up for the righteous,
verses.ln2: and joyful gladness for those who are truehearted.

verses.ln1: Rejoice in the Lord, you righteous,
verses.ln2: and give thanks at the remembrance of his holiness.

verses.ln1: O sing unto the Lord a new song,
verses.ln2: for he has done marvelous things.

verses.ln1: With his own right hand and with his holy arm,
verses.ln2: he has won for himself the victory.

verses.ln1: The Lord declared his salvation;
verses.ln2: his righteousness has he openly shown in the sight of the nations.

verses.ln1: He has remembered his mercy and truth toward the house of Israel,
verses.ln2: and all the ends of the world have seen the salvation of our God.

verses.ln1: Show yourselves joyful in the Lord, all you lands;
verses.ln2: sing, rejoice, and give thanks.

verses.ln1: Praise the Lord with the harp;
verses.ln2: sing with the harp a psalm of thanksgiving.

verses.ln1: With trumpets also and horns,
verses.ln2: O show yourselves joyful before the Lord, the King.

verses.ln1: Let the sea make a noise, and all that is in it,
verses.ln2: the round world, and those who dwell therein.

verses.ln1: Let the rivers clap their hands, and let the hills be joyful together before the Lord,
verses.ln2: for he has come to judge the earth.

verses.ln1: With righteousness shall he judge the world,
verses.ln2: and the peoples with equity.

verses.ln1: The Lord is King; let the peoples tremble;
verses.ln2: he sits between the cherubim; let the earth shake.

verses.ln1: The Lord is great in Zion
verses.ln2: and high above all peoples.

verses.ln1: They shall give thanks unto his Name, which is great and wonderful;
verses.ln2: holy is he and mighty, a King who loves justice.

verses.ln1: You have established equity;
verses.ln2: you have executed judgment and righteousness in Jacob.

verses.ln1: O magnify the Lord our God,
verses.ln2: and fall down before his footstool, for he is holy.

verses.ln1: Moses and Aaron among his priests, and Samuel among those who call upon his Name,
verses.ln2: they called upon the Lord, and he heard them.

verses.ln1: He spoke to them out of the cloudy pillar,
verses.ln2: for they kept his testimonies and the law that he gave them.

verses.ln1: You heard them, O Lord our God;
verses.ln2: you forgave them, O God, yet punished their evildoings.

verses.ln1: O magnify the Lord our God, and worship him upon his holy hill,
verses.ln2: for the Lord our God is holy.

verses.ln1: O be joyful in the Lord, all you lands;
verses.ln2: serve the Lord with gladness, and come before his presence with a song.

verses.ln1: Be assured that the Lord, he is God;
verses.ln2: it is he that has made us, and not we ourselves; we are his people, and the sheep of his pasture.

verses.ln1: O go your way into his gates with thanksgiving, and into his courts with praise;
verses.ln2: be thankful unto him, and speak good of his Name.

verses.ln1: For the Lord is gracious, his mercy is everlasting,
verses.ln2: and his truth endures from generation to generation.

verses.ln1: My song shall be of mercy and judgment;
verses.ln2: unto you, O Lord, will I sing.

verses.ln1: O let me have understanding
verses.ln2: in the way of godliness.

verses.ln1: When will you come to me?
verses.ln2: I will walk in my house with integrity of heart.

verses.ln1: I will set no wicked thing before my eyes;
verses.ln2: I hate the sins of unfaithfulness; no such thing shall cleave to me.

verses.ln1: A crooked heart shall depart from me;
verses.ln2: I will not know a wicked person.

verses.ln1: Whoever secretly slanders his neighbor,
verses.ln2: him will I destroy.

verses.ln1: Whoever has a proud look and an arrogant heart,
verses.ln2: I will not suffer him.

verses.ln1: My eyes shall look with favor upon the faithful in the land,
verses.ln2: that they may dwell with me.

verses.ln1: Whoever leads a godly life,
verses.ln2: he shall be my servant.

verses.ln1: No deceitful person shall dwell in my house;
verses.ln2: the one who tells lies shall not tarry in my sight.

verses.ln1: I shall soon destroy all the ungodly who are in the land,
verses.ln2: that I may root out all evildoers from the city of the Lord.

verses.ln1: Hear my prayer, O Lord,
verses.ln2: and let my cry come unto you.

verses.ln1: Hide not your face from me in the time of my trouble;
verses.ln2: incline your ear to me when I call; O hear me, and very soon.

verses.ln1: For my days are consumed like smoke,
verses.ln2: and my bones are burnt up as in a furnace.

verses.ln1: My heart is smitten and withered like grass,
verses.ln2: so that I forget to eat my bread.

verses.ln1: Because of the voice of my groaning,
verses.ln2: my bones will scarcely cleave to my flesh.

verses.ln1: I have become like an owl in the wilderness
verses.ln2: and like a screech-owl among the ruins.

verses.ln1: I am solitary, and lie sleepless because of my groaning;
verses.ln2: I am like a sparrow that sits alone upon the housetop.

verses.ln1: My enemies revile me all day long,
verses.ln2: and those who are enraged against me conspire to do me hurt.

verses.ln1: For I have eaten ashes as if they were bread
verses.ln2: and mingled my drink with weeping,

verses.ln1: Because of your indignation and wrath,
verses.ln2: for you have taken me up and cast me down.

verses.ln1: My days are gone like a shadow,
verses.ln2: and I am withered like grass.

verses.ln1: But you, O Lord, shall endure for ever,
verses.ln2: and your remembrance throughout all generations.

verses.ln1: You shall arise and have mercy upon Zion,
verses.ln2: for it is time for you to have mercy upon her; indeed, the time has come.

verses.ln1: For your servants love her very stones,
verses.ln2: and are moved to pity to see her in the dust.

verses.ln1: The nations shall fear your Name, O Lord,
verses.ln2: and all the kings of the earth your majesty,

verses.ln1: When the Lord shall build up Zion,
verses.ln2: and when his glory shall appear,

verses.ln1: When he turns to the prayer of the destitute
verses.ln2: and despises not their plea.

verses.ln1: This shall be written for those that come after,
verses.ln2: and a people that shall yet be born shall praise the Lord.

verses.ln1: For he has looked down from his sanctuary;
verses.ln2: from the heavens the Lord has beheld the earth,

verses.ln1: That he might hear the groanings of those who are in captivity,*
verses.ln2: and deliver those who are condemned to die,

verses.ln1: That they may declare the Name of the Lord in Zion,
verses.ln2: and his praises in Jerusalem;

verses.ln1: When the peoples are gathered together,
verses.ln2: and the kingdoms also, to serve the Lord.

verses.ln1: He brought down my strength before my time,
verses.ln2: and shortened my days.

verses.ln1: But I said, “O my God, take me not away in the midst of my days;
verses.ln2: for your years endure throughout all generations.”

verses.ln1: You, Lord, in the beginning laid the foundation of the earth,
verses.ln2: and the heavens are the work of your hands.

verses.ln1: They shall perish, but you shall endure;
verses.ln2: they all shall wear out, as does a garment;

verses.ln1: And as a garment you shall change them, and they shall be changed;
verses.ln2: but you are the same, and your years shall not fail.

verses.ln1: The children of your servants shall continue,
verses.ln2: and their seed shall stand fast in your sight.

verses.ln1: Praise the Lord, O my soul,
verses.ln2: and all that is within me, praise his holy Name.

verses.ln1: Praise the Lord, O my soul,
verses.ln2: and forget not all his benefits:

verses.ln1: Who forgives all your sin
verses.ln2: and heals all your infirmities,

verses.ln1: Who saves your life from the pit
verses.ln2: and crowns you with mercy and loving-kindness,

verses.ln1: Who satisfies you with good things,
verses.ln2: renewing your youth like an eagle’s.

verses.ln1: The Lord executes righteousness and judgment
verses.ln2: for all those who are oppressed with wrong.

verses.ln1: He showed his ways to Moses,
verses.ln2: his works to the children of Israel.

verses.ln1: The Lord is full of compassion and mercy,
verses.ln2: long-suffering and of great goodness.

verses.ln1: He will not always chide us,
verses.ln2: neither will he keep his anger for ever.

verses.ln1: He has not dealt with us according to our sins,
verses.ln2: nor rewarded us according to our wickedness.

verses.ln1: For as the heavens are high above the earth,
verses.ln2: so great is his mercy also toward those who fear him.

verses.ln1: As far as the east is from the west,
verses.ln2: so far has he set our sins from us.

verses.ln1: As a father pities his own children,
verses.ln2: so is the Lord merciful to those who fear him.

verses.ln1: For he knows whereof we are made;
verses.ln2: he remembers that we are but dust.

verses.ln1: The days of man are as grass;
verses.ln2: he flourishes as a flower of the field.

verses.ln1: For as soon as the wind goes over it, it is gone,
verses.ln2: and its place shall know it no more.

verses.ln1: But the merciful goodness of the Lord endures for ever and ever upon those who fear him,
verses.ln2: and his righteousness upon children’s children,

verses.ln1: Even upon those who keep his covenant
verses.ln2: and think upon his commandments to do them.

verses.ln1: The Lord has prepared his throne in heaven,
verses.ln2: and his kingdom rules over all.

verses.ln1: O praise the Lord, you angels of his, you that excel in strength,
verses.ln2: you that fulfill his commandment, and hearken unto the voice of his words.

verses.ln1: O praise the Lord, all you his hosts,
verses.ln2: you servants of his that do his pleasure.

verses.ln1: O speak good of the Lord, all you works of his, in all places of his dominion;
verses.ln2: praise the Lord, O my soul.

verses.ln1: Praise the Lord, O my soul.
verses.ln2: O Lord my God, you have become exceedingly glorious; you are clothed with majesty and honor.

verses.ln1: You clothe yourself with light as with a garment,
verses.ln2: and spread out the heavens like a curtain.

verses.ln1: You lay the beams of your chambers in the waters,
verses.ln2: and make the clouds your chariot, and walk upon the wings of the wind.

verses.ln1: You make winds your messengers,
verses.ln2: and flames of fire your ministers.

verses.ln1: You laid the foundations of the earth,
verses.ln2: that it never should move at any time.

verses.ln1: You cover it with the deep as with a garment;
verses.ln2: the waters stand above the hills.

verses.ln1: At your rebuke they fled;
verses.ln2: at the voice of your thunder they hastened away.

verses.ln1: They went up as high as the hills, and down to the valleys beneath,
verses.ln2: even to the place you had appointed for them.

verses.ln1: You have set bounds for them which they shall not pass;
verses.ln2: neither shall they again cover the earth.

verses.ln1: You send the springs into the rivers,
verses.ln2: which run among the hills.

verses.ln1: All beasts of the field drink thereof,
verses.ln2: and the wild donkeys quench their thirst.

verses.ln1: Beside them shall the birds of the air have their habitation
verses.ln2: and sing among the branches.

verses.ln1: You water the hills from above;
verses.ln2: the earth is filled with the fruit of your works.

verses.ln1: You bring forth grass for the cattle,
verses.ln2: and plants for the service of mankind,

verses.ln1: That they may bring food out of the earth, and wine that makes glad the heart,
verses.ln2: and oil to make a cheerful countenance, and bread to strengthen the heart.

verses.ln1: The trees of the Lord also are full of sap,
verses.ln2: even the cedars of Lebanon which he planted,

verses.ln1: Wherein the birds make their nests,
verses.ln2: and the fir trees are a dwelling for the stork.

verses.ln1: The high hills are a refuge for the wild goats,
verses.ln2: and so are the stony cliffs for the rock badgers.

verses.ln1: You appointed the moon to mark the seasons,
verses.ln2: and the sun knows its going down.

verses.ln1: You make darkness that it may be night,
verses.ln2: in which all the beasts of the forest move.

verses.ln1: The lions, roaring after their prey,
verses.ln2: seek their meat from God.

verses.ln1: The sun arises, and they go away together,
verses.ln2: and lay themselves down in their dens.

verses.ln1: Man goes forth to his work,
verses.ln2: and to his labor until the evening.

verses.ln1: O Lord, how manifold are your works;
verses.ln2: in wisdom you made them all; the earth is full of your creatures.

verses.ln1: So is the great and wide sea also,
verses.ln2: in which are things creeping innumerable, creatures both small and great.

verses.ln1: There go the ships, and there is that Leviathan,
verses.ln2: whom you made to take its pleasure therein.

verses.ln1: These all wait upon you,
verses.ln2: that you may give them food in due season.

verses.ln1: When you give it to them, they gather it,
verses.ln2: and when you open your hand, they are filled with good things.

verses.ln1: When you hide your face, they are troubled;
verses.ln2: when you take away their breath, they die, and are turned again to their dust.

verses.ln1: When you let your breath go forth, they shall be made,
verses.ln2: and you shall renew the face of the earth.

verses.ln1: The glorious majesty of the Lord shall endure for ever;
verses.ln2: the Lord shall rejoice in his works.

verses.ln1: He looks at the earth and it trembles;
verses.ln2: if he even touches the hills, they shall smoke.

verses.ln1: I will sing unto the Lord as long as I live;
verses.ln2: I will praise my God while I have my being,

verses.ln1: And so shall my words please him;
verses.ln2: my joy shall be in the Lord.

verses.ln1: As for sinners, they shall perish from the earth, and the ungodly shall come to an end.
verses.ln2: Praise the Lord, O my soul. Praise the Lord.

verses.ln1: Give thanks unto the Lord and call upon his Name;
verses.ln2: tell the peoples what things he has done.

verses.ln1: O let your songs be of him, and praise him,
verses.ln2: and let your speech be of all his wondrous works.

verses.ln1: Rejoice in his holy Name;
verses.ln2: let the hearts of those who seek the Lord rejoice.

verses.ln1: Seek the Lord and his strength;
verses.ln2: seek his face evermore.

verses.ln1: Remember the marvelous works that he has done,
verses.ln2: his wonders, and the judgments of his mouth,

verses.ln1: O seed of Abraham his servant,
verses.ln2: O children of Jacob his chosen.

verses.ln1: He is the Lord our God;
verses.ln2: his judgments are in all the world.

verses.ln1: He has always been mindful of his covenant,
verses.ln2: and the promise that he made to a thousand generations,

verses.ln1: Even the covenant that he made with Abraham,
verses.ln2: and the oath that he swore to Isaac,

verses.ln1: Which he appointed to Jacob for a law,
verses.ln2: and to Israel for an everlasting testament,

verses.ln1: Saying, “To you will I give the land of Canaan
verses.ln2: to be the portion of your inheritance.”

verses.ln1: When there were yet but a few of them,
verses.ln2: and they were strangers in the land,

verses.ln1: And they wandered from nation to nation,
verses.ln2: and from one kingdom to another,

verses.ln1: He allowed no one to do them wrong,
verses.ln2: but reproved even kings for their sakes:

verses.ln1: “Do not touch my Anointed,
verses.ln2: and do my prophets no harm.”

verses.ln1: Moreover, he called for a famine in the land
verses.ln2: and destroyed all the provision of bread.

verses.ln1: But he had sent a man before them:
verses.ln2: Joseph, who was sold to be a bondservant,

verses.ln1: Whose feet they hurt in the stocks;
verses.ln2: they put an iron collar around his neck.

verses.ln1: Until the time came that his sayings were fulfilled,
verses.ln2: the word of the Lord tried him.

verses.ln1: The king sent and delivered him;
verses.ln2: the ruler of the people let him go free.

verses.ln1: He made him lord over his house,
verses.ln2: and ruler of all his possessions,

verses.ln1: That he might instruct his princes according to his will
verses.ln2: and teach his elders wisdom.

verses.ln1: Israel also came into Egypt,
verses.ln2: and Jacob was a stranger in the land of Ham.

verses.ln1: And he increased his people exceedingly,
verses.ln2: and made them stronger than their enemies,

verses.ln1: Whose heart he turned, so that they hated his people,
verses.ln2: and dealt deceitfully with his servants.

verses.ln1: Then he sent Moses his servant,
verses.ln2: and Aaron whom he had chosen,

verses.ln1: And they worked his signs among them,
verses.ln2: and wonders in the land of Ham.

verses.ln1: He sent darkness, and it was dark;
verses.ln2: but they were not obedient to his word.

verses.ln1: He turned their waters into blood
verses.ln2: and caused their fish to die.

verses.ln1: Their land brought forth frogs,
verses.ln2: even in their kings’ chambers.

verses.ln1: He spoke the word, and there came all manner of flies,
verses.ln2: and gnats in all their borders.

verses.ln1: He gave them hailstones for rain,
verses.ln2: and flames of fire in their land.

verses.ln1: He smote their vines also, and their fig trees,
verses.ln2: and destroyed the trees that were in their borders.

verses.ln1: He spoke the word, and the grasshoppers came, and locusts innumerable,
verses.ln2: which ate up all the grass in their land and devoured the fruit of their ground.

verses.ln1: He smote all the firstborn in their land,
verses.ln2: even the firstfruits of all their strength.

verses.ln1: He brought forth Israel with silver and gold;
verses.ln2: in all their tribes there was not one who stumbled.

verses.ln1: Egypt was glad at their departing,
verses.ln2: for they were afraid of them.

verses.ln1: He spread out a cloud to be a covering,
verses.ln2: and fire to give light in the night season.

verses.ln1: At their desire he brought quail,
verses.ln2: and he filled them with the bread of heaven.

verses.ln1: He opened the rock, and the waters flowed out,
verses.ln2: so that rivers ran in the dry places.

verses.ln1: For he remembered his holy promise
verses.ln2: and Abraham his servant.

verses.ln1: And he brought forth his people with joy,
verses.ln2: and his chosen ones with gladness,

verses.ln1: And gave them the lands of the nations,
verses.ln2: and they took the labors of the peoples in possession,

verses.ln1: That they might keep his statutes
verses.ln2: and observe his laws. Praise the Lord.

verses.ln1: O give thanks unto the Lord, for he is gracious,
verses.ln2: and his mercy endures for ever.

verses.ln1: Who can express the mighty acts of the Lord,
verses.ln2: or show forth all his praise?

verses.ln1: Blessed are those who act with justice,
verses.ln2: and who always do righteousness.

verses.ln1: Remember me, O Lord, according to the favor that you show to your people;
verses.ln2: O visit me with your salvation,

verses.ln1: That I may see the felicity of your chosen,
verses.ln2: and rejoice in the gladness of your people, and give thanks with your inheritance.

verses.ln1: We have sinned like our fathers;
verses.ln2: we have done wrong and dealt wickedly.

verses.ln1: Our fathers regarded not your wonders in Egypt, neither did they keep your great goodness in remembrance,
verses.ln2: but were disobedient at the sea, even at the Red Sea.

verses.ln1: Nevertheless, he saved them for his Name’s sake,
verses.ln2: that he might make his power known.

verses.ln1: He rebuked the Red Sea, and it was dried up;
verses.ln2: so he led them through the deep as through a wilderness.

verses.ln1: And he saved them from the adversary’s hand,
verses.ln2: and delivered them from the hand of the enemy.

verses.ln1: As for those who troubled them, the waters overwhelmed them;*
verses.ln2: there was not one of them left.

verses.ln1: Then they believed his words
verses.ln2: and sang praises unto him.

verses.ln1: But soon they forgot his works
verses.ln2: and would not wait for his counsel.

verses.ln1: A craving came upon them in the wilderness,
verses.ln2: and they tempted God in the desert.

verses.ln1: So he gave them their desire,
verses.ln2: and sent leanness into their soul.

verses.ln1: They were envious of Moses also in the camp,
verses.ln2: and of Aaron the holy one of the Lord.

verses.ln1: So the earth opened and swallowed up Dathan
verses.ln2: and covered the company of Abiram,

verses.ln1: And fire was kindled in their company;
verses.ln2: the flame burnt up the ungodly.

verses.ln1: They made a calf in Horeb
verses.ln2: and worshiped a molten image.

verses.ln1: Thus they exchanged their glory
verses.ln2: for the image of a calf that feeds on hay.

verses.ln1: And they forgot God their Savior,
verses.ln2: who had done great things in Egypt,

verses.ln1: Wondrous works in the land of Ham,
verses.ln2: and fearful things by the Red Sea.

verses.ln1: So he said he would have destroyed them, had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the gap
verses.ln2: to turn away his wrathful indignation, lest he should destroy them.

verses.ln1: Then they scorned that pleasant land
verses.ln2: and gave no credence to his word,

verses.ln1: But murmured in their tents
verses.ln2: and did not hearken to the voice of the Lord.

verses.ln1: Then he lifted up his hand against them
verses.ln2: to overthrow them in the wilderness,

verses.ln1: To cast out their seed among the nations,
verses.ln2: and to scatter them in all the lands.

verses.ln1: They joined themselves to Baal-Peor
verses.ln2: and ate the offerings to the dead.

verses.ln1: Thus they provoked him to anger with their wanton deeds,
verses.ln2: and the plague broke out among them.

verses.ln1: Then Phineas stood up and interceded,
verses.ln2: and so the plague was ended;

verses.ln1: And that was counted to him as righteousness
verses.ln2: among all generations for evermore.

verses.ln1: They angered him also at the waters of strife,
verses.ln2: so that he punished Moses for their misdeeds;

verses.ln1: For they provoked him to anger,
verses.ln2: so that he spoke rashly with his lips.

verses.ln1: Neither did they destroy the peoples
verses.ln2: as the Lord commanded them,

verses.ln1: But intermingled among the nations
verses.ln2: and learned their heathen ways,

verses.ln1: So that they worshiped their idols, which became a snare to them;
verses.ln2: they offered their sons and their daughters to demons,

verses.ln1: And shed innocent blood, even the blood of their sons and of their daughters,
verses.ln2: whom they offered to the idols of Canaan; and the land was defiled with blood.

verses.ln1: Thus were they defiled by their own works
verses.ln2: and went whoring with their own deeds.

verses.ln1: Therefore was the wrath of the Lord kindled against his people,
verses.ln2: and he abhorred his own inheritance,

verses.ln1: And he gave them over into the hands of the nations,
verses.ln2: and those who hated them were lords over them.

verses.ln1: Their enemies oppressed them
verses.ln2: and held them in subjection.

verses.ln1: Many a time did he deliver them,
verses.ln2: but they rebelled against him through their own devices, and were brought down in their wickedness.

verses.ln1: Nevertheless, when he saw their adversity,
verses.ln2: when he heard their lamentation,

verses.ln1: He remembered his covenant and pitied them, according to the multitude of his mercies;
verses.ln2: he made all those who led them away captive to pity them.

verses.ln1: Deliver us, O Lord our God, and gather us from among the nations,
verses.ln2: that we may give thanks to your holy Name and make our boast of your praise.

verses.ln1: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel from everlasting and world without end,
verses.ln2: and let all the people say, “Amen.” Praise the Lord.

verses.ln1: O give thanks unto the Lord, for he is gracious,
verses.ln2: and his mercy endures for ever.

verses.ln1: Let those whom the Lord has redeemed give thanks,
verses.ln2: whom he has delivered from the hand of the enemy,

verses.ln1: And gathered them out of the lands, from the east and from the west,
verses.ln2: from the north and from the south.

verses.ln1: They went astray in the wilderness, even in the desert,
verses.ln2: and found no city to dwell in;

verses.ln1: They were hungry and thirsty,
verses.ln2: and their soul fainted within them.

verses.ln1: Then they cried unto the Lord in their trouble,
verses.ln2: and he delivered them from their distress.

verses.ln1: He led them forth by a straight path
verses.ln2: until they came to a city where they might dwell.

verses.ln1: Oh, that they would therefore praise the Lord for his goodness
verses.ln2: and declare the wonders that he does for the children of men!

verses.ln1: For he satisfies the empty soul
verses.ln2: and fills the hungry soul with goodness.

verses.ln1: Some sat in darkness, and in the shadow of death,
verses.ln2: being bound fast in misery and iron,

verses.ln1: Because they rebelled against the words of God
verses.ln2: and lightly regarded the counsel of the Most High.

verses.ln1: He also brought down their heart with heaviness;
verses.ln2: they fell down, and there was none to help them.

verses.ln1: Then they cried unto the Lord in their trouble,
verses.ln2: and he delivered them out of their distress.

verses.ln1: For he brought them out of darkness, and out of the shadow of death,
verses.ln2: and broke their bonds asunder.

verses.ln1: Oh, that they would therefore praise the Lord for his goodness
verses.ln2: and declare the wonders that he does for the children of men!

verses.ln1: For he has broken the gates of brass
verses.ln2: and shattered the bars of iron asunder.

verses.ln1: The foolish were plagued for their offense
verses.ln2: and because of their wickedness.

verses.ln1: Their soul abhorred all manner of food,
verses.ln2: and they were even close to death’s door.

verses.ln1: So when they cried unto the Lord in their trouble,
verses.ln2: he delivered them out of their distress.

verses.ln1: He sent his word and healed them,
verses.ln2: and they were saved from destruction.

verses.ln1: Oh, that they would therefore praise the Lord for his goodness
verses.ln2: and declare the wonders that he does for the children of men!

verses.ln1: That they would offer unto him the sacrifice of thanksgiving
verses.ln2: and tell of his works with gladness!

verses.ln1: Those who go down to the sea in ships,
verses.ln2: who carry out their business in great waters,

verses.ln1: They behold the works of the Lord
verses.ln2: and his wonders in the deep.

verses.ln1: For at his word the stormy wind arises,
verses.ln2: which lifts up the waves.

verses.ln1: They are carried up to heaven and down again to the deep;
verses.ln2: their soul melts away because of the trouble.

verses.ln1: They reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man,
verses.ln2: and are at their wits’ end.

verses.ln1: So when they cry unto the Lord in their trouble,
verses.ln2: he delivers them out of their distress.

verses.ln1: For he makes the storm to cease,
verses.ln2: so that the waves are still.

verses.ln1: Then they are glad, because they are at rest,
verses.ln2: and so he brings them into the haven where they desire to be.

verses.ln1: Oh, that they would therefore praise the Lord for his goodness
verses.ln2: and declare the wonders that he does for the children of men!

verses.ln1: That they would exalt him also in the congregation of the people
verses.ln2: and praise him in the seat of the elders!

verses.ln1: He turns rivers into a wilderness
verses.ln2: and water-springs into thirsty ground,

verses.ln1: A fruitful land he makes barren,
verses.ln2: because of the wickedness of those who dwell there.

verses.ln1: Again, he makes the wilderness into pools of water
verses.ln2: and dry ground into water-springs;

verses.ln1: And there he sets the hungry
verses.ln2: that they may build a city to dwell in,

verses.ln1: That they may sow their land and plant vineyards
verses.ln2: to yield the fruits of increase.

verses.ln1: He blesses them, so that they multiply exceedingly,
verses.ln2: and does not allow their cattle to decrease.

verses.ln1: And again, when they are diminished and brought low,
verses.ln2: through oppression, through any plague or trouble,

verses.ln1: Though he pours contempt on princes
verses.ln2: and lets them wander in the pathless wilderness,

verses.ln1: Yet he helps the poor out of misery
verses.ln2: and increases their households like a flock of sheep.

verses.ln1: The righteous will consider this and rejoice,
verses.ln2: and the mouth of all wickedness shall be stopped.

verses.ln1: Whoever is wise will ponder these things,
verses.ln2: and shall understand the loving-kindness of the Lord.

verses.ln1: O God, my heart is fixed, my heart is firmly fixed;
verses.ln2: I will sing and give praise with the best that I have.

verses.ln1: Awake, my soul; awake, lute and harp;
verses.ln2: I myself will awaken the dawn.

verses.ln1: I will give thanks unto you, O Lord, among the peoples,
verses.ln2: and I will sing praises unto you among the nations,

verses.ln1: For the greatness of your mercy reaches to the heavens,
verses.ln2: and your faithfulness to the clouds.

verses.ln1: Exalt yourself, O God, above the heavens;
verses.ln2: let your glory be over all the earth.

verses.ln1: That your beloved may be delivered,
verses.ln2: save me by your right hand, and answer me.

verses.ln1: God has spoken in his holiness:
verses.ln2: “I will rejoice and divide Shechem, and parcel out the valley of Succoth.

verses.ln1: Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine;
verses.ln2: Ephraim also is the helmet for my head; Judah is my scepter.

verses.ln1: Moab is my wash-pot; over Edom will I cast my shoe;
verses.ln2: over Philistia will I triumph.”

verses.ln1: Who will lead me into the strong city,
verses.ln2: and who will bring me into Edom?

verses.ln1: Have you not forsaken us, O God?
verses.ln2: And will you not, O God, go forth with our hosts?

verses.ln1: O help us against the enemy,
verses.ln2: for vain is the help of man.

verses.ln1: Through God we shall do great acts,
verses.ln2: for it is he who shall tread down our enemies.

verses.ln1: Hold not your tongue, O God of my praise,
verses.ln2: for the mouth of the ungodly, the mouth of the deceitful is opened upon me.

verses.ln1: They have spoken against me with false tongues;
verses.ln2: they encompassed me with words of hatred, and fought against me without a cause.

verses.ln1: In return for the love that I had for them, they have become my adversaries;
verses.ln2: but I give myself to prayer.

verses.ln1: Thus have they rewarded me evil for good,
verses.ln2: and hatred for my love.

verses.ln1: Set an ungodly man to be ruler over him,
verses.ln2: and let an accuser stand at his right hand.

verses.ln1: When judgment is given, let him be condemned,
verses.ln2: and let sentence be passed on him for guilt.

verses.ln1: Let his days be few,
verses.ln2: and let another take his office.

verses.ln1: Let his children be fatherless
verses.ln2: and his wife a widow.

verses.ln1: Let his children be vagabonds and beg their bread;
verses.ln2: let them be driven out, even from desolate places.

verses.ln1: Let the creditor consume all that he has,
verses.ln2: and let strangers take his labor for spoil.

verses.ln1: Let there be no one to pity him,
verses.ln2: nor to have compassion upon his fatherless children.

verses.ln1: Let his posterity be destroyed,
verses.ln2: and in the next generation let his name be blotted out.

verses.ln1: Let the wickedness of his fathers be held in remembrance in the sight of the Lord,
verses.ln2: and let not the sin of his mother be blotted out.

verses.ln1: Let them be always before the Lord,
verses.ln2: that he may root out the memorial of them from the earth,

verses.ln1: Because he was not minded to do good,
verses.ln2: but persecuted to death the poor and needy, and those who were brokenhearted.

verses.ln1: His delight was in cursing; let curses come upon him;
verses.ln2: he loved not blessing; therefore let it be far from him.

verses.ln1: He clothed himself with cursing as with a garment,
verses.ln2: so let it soak into his body like water, and like oil into his bones.

verses.ln1: Let it be to him as the cloak that he has on
verses.ln2: and as the belt that he always wears.

verses.ln1: Let this be the recompense from the Lord to my enemies,
verses.ln2: and to those who speak evil against my soul.

verses.ln1: But deal with me, O Lord God, according to your Name;
verses.ln2: for sweet is your mercy.

verses.ln1: O deliver me, for I am helpless and poor,
verses.ln2: and my heart is wounded within me.

verses.ln1: I disappear like the shadow that lengthens,
verses.ln2: and am shaken off like a grasshopper.

verses.ln1: My knees are weak through fasting;
verses.ln2: my flesh is grown lean for want of nourishment.

verses.ln1: I have become a reproach to them;
verses.ln2: when they look on me, they shake their heads.

verses.ln1: Help me, O Lord my God;
verses.ln2: save me according to your mercy;

verses.ln1: And they shall know that this is your hand,
verses.ln2: and that you, O Lord, have done it.

verses.ln1: Though they curse, yet you bless;
verses.ln2: let them be confounded who rise up against me, but let your servant rejoice.

verses.ln1: Let my adversaries be clothed with shame,
verses.ln2: and let them cover themselves with their own disgrace as with a cloak.

verses.ln1: As for me, I will give great thanks unto the Lord with my mouth,
verses.ln2: and praise him among the multitude,

verses.ln1: For he shall stand at the right hand of the poor,
verses.ln2: to save their souls from the unrighteous judges.

verses.ln1: The Lord said unto my Lord, “Sit at my right hand,
verses.ln2: until I make your enemies your footstool.”

verses.ln1: The Lord shall send the scepter of your power out of Zion:
verses.ln2: “Rule in the midst of your enemies.”

verses.ln1: In the day of your power the people, in holy raiment, shall offer you freewill offerings;
verses.ln2: from the womb of the morning, the dew of your youth belongs to you.

verses.ln1: The Lord has sworn and will not recant:
verses.ln2: “You are a priest for ever after the order of Melchizedek.”

verses.ln1: The Lord at your right hand
verses.ln2: shall smite kings in the day of his wrath.

verses.ln1: He shall judge the nations;
verses.ln2: he shall fill the lands with dead bodies, and strike down heads over many countries.

verses.ln1: He shall drink from the brook by the way;
verses.ln2: therefore shall he lift up his head.

verses.ln1: Praise the Lord. I will give thanks unto the Lord with my whole heart,
verses.ln2: in the company of the upright, and among the congregation.

verses.ln1: The works of the Lord are great,
verses.ln2: sought out by all who have pleasure in them.

verses.ln1: His work is worthy to be praised and held in honor,
verses.ln2: and his righteousness endures for ever.

verses.ln1: He has made his marvelous works to be had in remembrance;
verses.ln2: The Lord is gracious and merciful.

verses.ln1: He has given food to those who fear him;
verses.ln2: he shall ever be mindful of his covenant.

verses.ln1: He has shown his people the power of his works,
verses.ln2: that he may give them the heritage of the nations.

verses.ln1: The works of his hands are faithfulness and justice;
verses.ln2: all his commandments are true.

verses.ln1: They stand fast for ever and ever,
verses.ln2: and are done in truth and equity.

verses.ln1: He sent redemption to his people; he has commanded his covenant for ever;
verses.ln2: holy and awesome is his Name.

verses.ln1: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom;
verses.ln2: a good understanding have all those who live accordingly; his praise endures for ever.

verses.ln1: Praise the Lord! Blessed is the one who fears the Lord,
verses.ln2: who has great delight in his commandments.

verses.ln1: His seed shall be mighty in the land;
verses.ln2: the generation of the faithful shall be blessed.

verses.ln1: Riches and plenteousness shall be in his house,
verses.ln2: and his righteousness shall endure for ever.

verses.ln1: For the upright, there rises light in the darkness;
verses.ln2: he is merciful, loving, and righteous.

verses.ln1: It is good for him to be generous in lending
verses.ln2: and to guide his words with discretion.

verses.ln1: For he shall never be moved,
verses.ln2: and the righteous shall be kept in everlasting remembrance.

verses.ln1: He will not be afraid of any evil tidings,
verses.ln2: for his heart is steadfast and trusts in the Lord.

verses.ln1: His heart is established, and will not fear;
verses.ln2: at the last he shall see his desire upon his enemies.

verses.ln1: He has given freely to the poor,
verses.ln2: and his righteousness endures for ever; his horn shall be exalted with honor.

verses.ln1: The ungodly shall see it, and shall be angry;
verses.ln2: he shall gnash his teeth, and waste away; the desire of the ungodly shall perish.

verses.ln1: Praise the Lord. Sing praises, you servants of the Lord;
verses.ln2: O praise the Name of the Lord.

verses.ln1: Blessed be the Name of the Lord,
verses.ln2: from this time forth for evermore.

verses.ln1: The Lord’s Name be praised
verses.ln2: from the rising up of the sun to the going down of the same.

verses.ln1: The Lord is high above all nations,
verses.ln2: and his glory above the heavens.

verses.ln1: Who is like the Lord our God, who has his dwelling so high,
verses.ln2: and yet humbles himself to behold the things that are in heaven and earth?

verses.ln1: He takes up the lowly out of the dust,
verses.ln2: and lifts the poor out of the ashes,

verses.ln1: That he may set them with the princes,
verses.ln2: even with the princes of his people.

verses.ln1: He gives the barren woman a home to dwell in,
verses.ln2:
and makes her to be a joyful mother of children. 
Praise the Lord.

verses.ln1: When Israel came out of Egypt,
verses.ln2: and the house of Jacob from among a people of a foreign tongue,

verses.ln1: Judah was God’s sanctuary,
verses.ln2: and Israel his dominion.

verses.ln1: The sea beheld it and fled;
verses.ln2: Jordan was driven back.

verses.ln1: The mountains skipped like rams,
verses.ln2: and the little hills like young sheep.

verses.ln1: What ailed you, O sea, that you fled?
verses.ln2: O Jordan, that you were driven back?

verses.ln1: You mountains, that you skipped like rams,
verses.ln2: and you little hills like young sheep?

verses.ln1: Tremble, O earth, at the presence of the Lord,
verses.ln2: at the presence of the God of Jacob,

verses.ln1: Who turned the hard rock into a pool of water,
verses.ln2: and the flint stone into a springing well.

verses.ln1: Not unto us, O Lord, not unto us, but unto your Name give the praise,
verses.ln2: for your loving mercy and for your truth’s sake.

verses.ln1: Why shall the nations say,
verses.ln2: “Where now is their God?”

verses.ln1: As for our God, he is in heaven;
verses.ln2: he has done whatsoever pleased him.

verses.ln1: Their idols are silver and gold,
verses.ln2: even the work of human hands.

verses.ln1: They have mouths, but they speak not;
verses.ln2: eyes have they, but they see not.

verses.ln1: They have ears, but they hear not;
verses.ln2: noses have they, but they smell not.

verses.ln1: They have hands, but they feel not; feet have they, but they walk not;
verses.ln2: neither is there any sound in their throat.

verses.ln1: Those who make them are like them,
verses.ln2: and so are all who put their trust in them.

verses.ln1: But you, O house of Israel, trust in the Lord;
verses.ln2: he is their helper and defender.

verses.ln1: You house of Aaron, put your trust in the Lord;
verses.ln2: he is their helper and defender.

verses.ln1: You who fear the Lord, put your trust in the Lord;
verses.ln2: he is their helper and defender.

verses.ln1: The Lord has been mindful of us, and he shall bless us;
verses.ln2: he shall bless the house of Israel; he shall bless the house of Aaron;

verses.ln1: He shall bless those who fear the Lord,
verses.ln2: both small and great together.

verses.ln1: The Lord shall increase you more and more,
verses.ln2: you and your children after you.

verses.ln1: You are the blessed of the Lord,
verses.ln2: who has made heaven and earth.

verses.ln1: The heavens are the Lord’s;
verses.ln2: the earth has he given to the children of men.

verses.ln1: The dead praise you not, O Lord,
verses.ln2: neither all those who go down into silence.

verses.ln1: But we will praise the Lord,
verses.ln2: from this time forth for evermore. Praise the Lord.

verses.ln1: I love the Lord,
verses.ln2: because he heard the voice of my prayer,

verses.ln1: Because he inclined his ear to me;
verses.ln2: therefore will I call upon him as long as I live.

verses.ln1: The snares of death encompassed me, and the pains of the Grave laid hold of me;
verses.ln2: I suffered trouble and sorrow.

verses.ln1: Then I called upon the Name of the Lord:
verses.ln2: “O Lord, I beseech you, deliver my soul.”

verses.ln1: Gracious is the Lord and righteous;
verses.ln2: indeed, our God is full of compassion.

verses.ln1: The Lord preserves the simple;
verses.ln2: I was in misery, and he helped me.

verses.ln1: Turn again to your rest, O my soul,
verses.ln2: for the Lord has rewarded you.

verses.ln1: You have delivered my soul from death,
verses.ln2: my eyes from tears, and my feet from stumbling.

verses.ln1: I will walk before the Lord
verses.ln2: in the land of the living.

verses.ln1: I believed, and therefore will I speak: “I am greatly troubled.”
verses.ln2: I said in my haste, “All men are liars.”

verses.ln1: What shall I give unto the Lord
verses.ln2: for all the benefits that he has done unto me?

verses.ln1: I will lift up the cup of salvation
verses.ln2: and call upon the Name of the Lord.

verses.ln1: I will pay my vows unto the Lord in the presence of all his people;
verses.ln2: dear in the sight of the Lord is the death of his saints.

verses.ln1: O Lord, I am your servant;
verses.ln2: I am your servant, and the child of your handmaid; you have broken my bonds asunder.

verses.ln1: I will offer you the sacrifice of thanksgiving
verses.ln2: and will call upon the Name of the Lord.

verses.ln1: I will pay my vows unto the Lord in the sight of all his people,
verses.ln2: in the courts of the Lord’s house, even in the midst of you, O Jerusalem. Praise the Lord.

verses.ln1: O praise the Lord, all you nations;
verses.ln2: praise him, all you peoples.

verses.ln1: For great is his loving-kindness towards us,
verses.ln2:
and the faithfulness of the Lord endures for ever. 
Praise the Lord.

verses.ln1: Give thanks unto the Lord, for he is gracious;
verses.ln2: his mercy endures for ever.

verses.ln1: Let Israel now confess that he is gracious,
verses.ln2: that his mercy endures for ever.

verses.ln1: Let the house of Aaron now confess
verses.ln2: that his mercy endures for ever.

verses.ln1: Indeed, let those who fear the Lord confess
verses.ln2: that his mercy endures for ever.

verses.ln1: I called upon the Lord in trouble,
verses.ln2: and the Lord heard me and set me free.

verses.ln1: The Lord is on my side;
verses.ln2: I will not fear what man can do to me.

verses.ln1: The Lord takes my side with those who help me;
verses.ln2: therefore shall I look in triumph on my enemies.

verses.ln1: It is better to trust in the Lord
verses.ln2: than to put any confidence in man.

verses.ln1: It is better to trust in the Lord
verses.ln2: than to put any confidence in princes.

verses.ln1: All the nations encompass me,
verses.ln2: but in the Name of the Lord will I cut them off.

verses.ln1: They hem me in on every side; indeed, they hem me in on every side,
verses.ln2: but in the Name of the Lord will I cut them off.

verses.ln1: They come about me like bees, and blaze like fire among the thorns,
verses.ln2: but in the Name of the Lord will I cut them off.

verses.ln1: I was thrust aside so that I almost fell,
verses.ln2: but the Lord was my help.

verses.ln1: The Lord is my strength and my song,
verses.ln2: and has become my salvation.

verses.ln1: The voice of joy and deliverance is in the dwellings of the righteous;
verses.ln2: the right hand of the Lord brings mighty things to pass.

verses.ln1: The right hand of the Lord is exalted;
verses.ln2: the right hand of the Lord brings mighty things to pass.

verses.ln1: I shall not die, but live,
verses.ln2: and declare the works of the Lord.

verses.ln1: The Lord has chastened and corrected me,
verses.ln2: but he has not given me over to death.

verses.ln1: Open unto me the gates of righteousness,
verses.ln2: that I may go into them, and give thanks unto the Lord.

verses.ln1: This is the gate of the Lord;
verses.ln2: the righteous shall enter into it.

verses.ln1: I will thank you, for you have heard me,
verses.ln2: and have become my salvation.

verses.ln1: The same stone which the builders refused
verses.ln2: has become the chief cornerstone.

verses.ln1: This is the Lord’s doing,
verses.ln2: and it is marvelous in our eyes.

verses.ln1: This is the day that the Lord has made;
verses.ln2: we will rejoice and be glad in it.

verses.ln1: Help me now, O Lord;
verses.ln2: O Lord, send us now prosperity.

verses.ln1: Blessed is he who comes in the Name of the Lord;
verses.ln2: we bless you from the house of the Lord.

verses.ln1: God is the Lord, who has shown us light;
verses.ln2: bind the sacrifice with cords, even to the horns of the altar.

verses.ln1: You are my God, and I will thank you;
verses.ln2: you are my God, and I will exalt you.

verses.ln1: O give thanks unto the Lord, for he is gracious;
verses.ln2: his mercy endures for ever.

verses.ln1: Blessed are those who are undefiled in their ways,
verses.ln2: and walk in the law of the Lord.

verses.ln1: Blessed are those who keep his testimonies
verses.ln2: and seek him with their whole heart,

verses.ln1: Even those who do no wickedness
verses.ln2: and perfectly walk in his ways.

verses.ln1: You have ordered your precepts
verses.ln2: that we should diligently keep them.

verses.ln1: O that my ways were made so direct
verses.ln2: that I might keep your statutes!

verses.ln1: Then would I not be put to shame
verses.ln2: while I give heed unto all your commandments.

verses.ln1: I will thank you with an upright heart,
verses.ln2: when I have learned your righteous judgments.

verses.ln1: I will keep your statutes;
verses.ln2: O do not forsake me utterly.

verses.ln1: How shall a young man cleanse his way?
verses.ln2: By ruling himself according to your word.

verses.ln1: With my whole heart I have sought you;
verses.ln2: O let me not go astray from your commandments.

verses.ln1: Your words have I hidden within my heart,
verses.ln2: that I may not sin against you.

verses.ln1: Blessed are you, O Lord;
verses.ln2: teach me your statutes.

verses.ln1: With my lips have I been telling
verses.ln2: of all the judgments of your mouth.

verses.ln1: I have had greater delight in the way of your testimonies
verses.ln2: than in all manner of riches.

verses.ln1: I will meditate on your commandments
verses.ln2: and have respect for all your ways.

verses.ln1: My delight will be in your statutes,
verses.ln2: and I will not forget your word.

verses.ln1: O do well unto your servant,
verses.ln2: that I may live, and keep your word.

verses.ln1: Open my eyes that I may see
verses.ln2: the wondrous things of your law.

verses.ln1: I am a sojourner on earth;
verses.ln2: O hide not your commandments from me.

verses.ln1: My soul is consumed with the fervent desire
verses.ln2: that it always has for your judgments.

verses.ln1: You have rebuked the proud,
verses.ln2: and cursed are those who stray from your commandments.

verses.ln1: O turn from me shame and contempt,
verses.ln2: for I have kept your testimonies.

verses.ln1: Though princes sit and speak against me,
verses.ln2: yet will your servant meditate on your statutes;

verses.ln1: For your testimonies are my delight,
verses.ln2: and they are my counselors.

verses.ln1: My soul cleaves to the dust;
verses.ln2: O revive me, according to your word.

verses.ln1: I have acknowledged my ways, and you heard me;
verses.ln2: O teach me your statutes.

verses.ln1: Make me to understand the way of your commandments,
verses.ln2: and so shall I meditate on your wondrous works.

verses.ln1: My soul melts away for heaviness;
verses.ln2: comfort me according to your word.

verses.ln1: Take from me the way of lying,
verses.ln2: and graciously teach me your law.

verses.ln1: I have chosen the way of truth,
verses.ln2: and your judgments have I set before me.

verses.ln1: I hold fast to your testimonies;
verses.ln2: O Lord, let me not be put to shame.

verses.ln1: I will run the way of your commandments
verses.ln2: when you enlarge my heart with understanding.

verses.ln1: Teach me, O Lord, the way of your statutes,
verses.ln2: and I shall keep it to the end.

verses.ln1: Give me understanding, and I shall keep your law;
verses.ln2: indeed, I shall keep it with my whole heart.

verses.ln1: Make me go in the path of your commandments,
verses.ln2: for therein is my desire.

verses.ln1: Incline my heart to your testimonies,
verses.ln2: and not to covetous desires.

verses.ln1: O turn away my eyes, lest they behold vanity,
verses.ln2: and revive me in your ways.

verses.ln1: Confirm your word to your servant,
verses.ln2: and to all those who fear you.

verses.ln1: Take away the reproach that I am afraid of,
verses.ln2: for your judgments are good.

verses.ln1: Behold, my delight is in your precepts;
verses.ln2: O revive me in your righteousness.

verses.ln1: Let your loving mercy come to me, O Lord,
verses.ln2: even your salvation, according to your word.

verses.ln1: So shall I answer those who taunt me,
verses.ln2: for my trust is in your word.

verses.ln1: O do not take the word of your truth utterly out of my mouth,*
verses.ln2: for my hope is in your judgments.

verses.ln1: So shall I always keep your law,
