verses.ln2: even for ever and ever;

verses.ln1: And I will walk at liberty,
verses.ln2: for I seek your commandments.

verses.ln1: I will speak of your testimonies also, even before kings,
verses.ln2: and will not be ashamed;

verses.ln1: And my delight shall be in your commandments,
verses.ln2: which I have loved exceedingly.

verses.ln1: My hands also will I lift up to your commandments,
verses.ln2: and I will meditate on your statutes.

verses.ln1: O remember your word to your servant,
verses.ln2: in which you have caused me to put my trust.

verses.ln1: This is my comfort in my trouble,
verses.ln2: for your word has given me life.

verses.ln1: The proud have held me exceedingly in derision,
verses.ln2: yet I have not turned aside from your law.

verses.ln1: For I have remembered, O Lord, your judgments from of old,
verses.ln2: and by them I have received comfort.

verses.ln1: I am filled with indignation,
verses.ln2: because of the ungodly who forsake your law.

verses.ln1: Your statutes have been my songs
verses.ln2: in the house of my pilgrimage.

verses.ln1: I have thought upon your Name, O Lord, in the night season,*
verses.ln2: and I have kept your law.

verses.ln1: This has been my reward,
verses.ln2: because I have kept your commandments.

verses.ln1: You are my portion, O Lord;
verses.ln2: I have promised to keep your law.

verses.ln1: I made my humble petition in your presence with my whole heart;
verses.ln2: O be merciful to me, according to your word.

verses.ln1: I have called my ways to remembrance
verses.ln2: and turned my feet to your testimonies.

verses.ln1: I made haste and did not delay
verses.ln2: to keep your commandments.

verses.ln1: The cords of the ungodly have encircled me,
verses.ln2: but I have not forgotten your law.

verses.ln1: At midnight I will rise to give thanks to you,
verses.ln2: because of your righteous judgments.

verses.ln1: I am a companion of all those who fear you
verses.ln2: and keep your commandments.

verses.ln1: The earth, O Lord, is full of your mercy;
verses.ln2: O teach me your statutes.

verses.ln1: O Lord, you have dealt graciously with your servant,
verses.ln2: according to your word.

verses.ln1: O teach me true understanding and knowledge,
verses.ln2: for I have believed your commandments.

verses.ln1: Before I was afflicted I went astray,
verses.ln2: but now I keep your word.

verses.ln1: You are good and gracious;
verses.ln2: O teach me your statutes.

verses.ln1: The proud have slandered me with lies,
verses.ln2: but I will keep your commandments with my whole heart.

verses.ln1: Their heart has become gross with fatness,
verses.ln2: but my delight is in your law.

verses.ln1: It is good for me that I have been afflicted,
verses.ln2: that I may learn your statutes.

verses.ln1: The law of your mouth is dearer to me
verses.ln2: than thousands in gold and silver.

verses.ln1: Your hands have made me and fashioned me;
verses.ln2: O give me understanding, that I may learn your commandments.

verses.ln1: Those who fear you will be glad when they see me,
verses.ln2: because I have put my trust in your word.

verses.ln1: I know, O Lord, that your judgments are right,
verses.ln2: and that in your faithfulness you have caused me to be afflicted.

verses.ln1: O let your merciful kindness be my comfort,
verses.ln2: according to your word to your servant.

verses.ln1: O let your loving mercies come to me, that I may live,
verses.ln2: for your law is my delight.

verses.ln1: Let the proud be put to shame, for they go about wickedly to destroy me;
verses.ln2: but I will meditate on your commandments.

verses.ln1: Let those who fear you turn to me,
verses.ln2: even those who know your testimonies.

verses.ln1: O let my heart be sound in your statutes,
verses.ln2: that I may never be put to shame.

verses.ln1: My soul has longed for your salvation,
verses.ln2: and I have a good hope because of your word.

verses.ln1: My eyes long sorely for your word,
verses.ln2: saying, “O when will you comfort me?”

verses.ln1: For I have become like a wineskin in the smoke,
verses.ln2: yet I do not forget your statutes.

verses.ln1: How many are the days of your servant?
verses.ln2: When will you execute judgment on those who persecute me?

verses.ln1: The proud have dug pits for me;
verses.ln2: they do not walk after your law.

verses.ln1: All your commandments are true.
verses.ln2: They persecute me falsely; O Lord, be my help.

verses.ln1: They had almost made an end of me on earth,
verses.ln2: but I have not forsaken your commandments.

verses.ln1: O revive me with your loving-kindness,
verses.ln2: and so shall I keep the testimonies of your mouth.

verses.ln1: O Lord, your word endures for ever;
verses.ln2: it stands fast in heaven.

verses.ln1: Your faithfulness remains from one generation to another;
verses.ln2: you have laid the foundation of the earth, and it abides.

verses.ln1: Surely your ordinances stand firm this day,
verses.ln2: for all things are your servants.

verses.ln1: If my delight had not been in your law,
verses.ln2: I should have perished in my affliction.

verses.ln1: I will never forget your commandments,
verses.ln2: for with them you have enlivened me.

verses.ln1: I am yours; O save me!
verses.ln2: For I have sought your commandments.

verses.ln1: The ungodly lie in wait for me to destroy me,
verses.ln2: but I will consider your testimonies.

verses.ln1: I see that all things come to an end,
verses.ln2: but your commandment has no bounds.

verses.ln1: Lord, what love I have for your law;
verses.ln2: all the day long I meditate on it.

verses.ln1: You, through your commandment, have made me wiser than my enemies,
verses.ln2: for it is always with me.

verses.ln1: I have more understanding than my teachers,
verses.ln2: for your testimonies are my study.

verses.ln1: I am wiser than the agéd,
verses.ln2: because I keep your commandments.

verses.ln1: I have restrained my feet from every evil way,
verses.ln2: that I may keep your word.

verses.ln1: I have not turned aside from your judgments,
verses.ln2: for you yourself have taught me.

verses.ln1: Oh how sweet are your words to my taste;
verses.ln2: indeed, sweeter than honey to my mouth.

verses.ln1: Through your commandments I get understanding;
verses.ln2: therefore I hate all evil ways.

verses.ln1: Your word is a lantern to my feet
verses.ln2: and a light upon my path.

verses.ln1: I have sworn and am steadfastly purposed
verses.ln2: to keep your righteous judgments.

verses.ln1: I am troubled above measure;
verses.ln2: revive me, O Lord, according to your word.

verses.ln1: Let the freewill offerings of my mouth please you, O Lord;
verses.ln2: and teach me your judgments.

verses.ln1: My life is always in my hand,
verses.ln2: yet I do not forget your law.

verses.ln1: The ungodly have laid a snare for me,
verses.ln2: yet I have not strayed from your commandments.

verses.ln1: Your testimonies have I claimed as my heritage for ever,
verses.ln2: and why? They are the very joy of my heart.

verses.ln1: I have applied my heart to fulfill your statutes always,
verses.ln2: even unto the end.

verses.ln1: I hate those who are double-minded,
verses.ln2: but your law do I love.

verses.ln1: You are my defense and shield,
verses.ln2: and my trust is in your word.

verses.ln1: Away from me, you wicked.
verses.ln2: I will keep the commandments of my God.

verses.ln1: Establish me according to your word, that I may live,
verses.ln2: and let me not be disappointed in my hope.

verses.ln1: Hold me up, and I shall be safe;
verses.ln2: indeed, my delight shall be ever in your statutes.

verses.ln1: You have trodden down all those who depart from your statutes,
verses.ln2: for they only imagine deceit.

verses.ln1: You put away all the ungodly of the earth like dross;
verses.ln2: therefore I love your testimonies.

verses.ln1: My flesh trembles for fear of you,
verses.ln2: and I am afraid of your judgments.

verses.ln1: I have done that which is lawful and right;
verses.ln2: O give me not over to my oppressors.

verses.ln1: Be surety for your servant’s good;
verses.ln2: O let not the arrogant oppress me.

verses.ln1: My eyes have wasted away with looking for your salvation,
verses.ln2: and for the word of your righteousness.

verses.ln1: O deal with your servant according to your loving mercy,
verses.ln2: and teach me your statutes.

verses.ln1: I am your servant; O grant me understanding,
verses.ln2: that I may know your testimonies.

verses.ln1: It is time for you, O Lord, to act,
verses.ln2: for they have broken your law.

verses.ln1: For I love your commandments above all things,
verses.ln2: more than gold and precious stones.

verses.ln1: Therefore I hold all your commandments to be right,
verses.ln2: and all false ways I utterly abhor.

verses.ln1: Your testimonies are wonderful;
verses.ln2: therefore does my soul keep them.

verses.ln1: When your word goes forth it gives light
verses.ln2: and understanding to the simple.

verses.ln1: I opened my mouth, and drew in my breath,
verses.ln2: for my delight was in your commandments.

verses.ln1: O look upon me, and be merciful unto me,
verses.ln2: as you always do for those who love your Name.

verses.ln1: Order my steps according to your word,
verses.ln2: and so shall no wickedness have dominion over me.

verses.ln1: O deliver me from those who deal wrongfully,
verses.ln2: and so shall I keep your commandments.

verses.ln1: Show the light of your countenance upon your servant,
verses.ln2: and teach me your statutes.

verses.ln1: My eyes gush out water
verses.ln2: because of those who do not keep your law.

verses.ln1: Righteous are you, O Lord,
verses.ln2: and true are your judgments.

verses.ln1: The testimonies that you have commanded
verses.ln2: are exceedingly righteous and true.

verses.ln1: My zeal has even consumed me,
verses.ln2: because my enemies have forgotten your words.

verses.ln1: Your word is tested to the uttermost,
verses.ln2: and therefore your servant loves it.

verses.ln1: I am small, and of no reputation,
verses.ln2: yet I do not forget your commandments.

verses.ln1: Your righteousness is an everlasting righteousness,
verses.ln2: and your law is the truth.

verses.ln1: Trouble and heaviness have taken hold of me,
verses.ln2: yet my delight is in your commandments.

verses.ln1: The righteousness of your testimonies is everlasting;
verses.ln2: O grant me understanding, and I shall live.

verses.ln1: I call with my whole heart.
verses.ln2: Hear me, O Lord; I will keep your statutes.

verses.ln1: Even unto you do I call;
verses.ln2: help me, and I shall keep your testimonies.

verses.ln1: Early in the morning do I cry unto you,
verses.ln2: for in your word is my trust.

verses.ln1: My eyes open before the night watches,
verses.ln2: that I may meditate on your words.

verses.ln1: Hear my voice, O Lord, according to your loving-kindness;
verses.ln2: give me life according to your judgments.

verses.ln1: They draw nigh who in malice persecute me,
verses.ln2: and are far from your law.

verses.ln1: Be near at hand, O Lord,
verses.ln2: for all your commandments are true.

verses.ln1: Concerning your testimonies, I have known long ago
verses.ln2: that you have founded them for ever.

verses.ln1: O consider my adversity and deliver me,
verses.ln2: for I do not forget your law.

verses.ln1: Plead my cause and deliver me;
verses.ln2: give me life according to your word.

verses.ln1: Salvation is far from the ungodly,
verses.ln2: for they do not regard your statutes.

verses.ln1: Great is your mercy, O Lord;
verses.ln2: give me life according to your judgments.

verses.ln1: Many there are who trouble me and persecute me,
verses.ln2: yet I do not swerve from your testimonies.

verses.ln1: It grieves me when I see the transgressors,
verses.ln2: because they do not keep your law.

verses.ln1: Consider, O Lord, how I love your commandments;
verses.ln2: O give me life according to your loving-kindness.

verses.ln1: Your word is true from everlasting;
verses.ln2: all the judgments of your righteousness endure for evermore.

verses.ln1: Princes have persecuted me without a cause,
verses.ln2: but my heart stands in awe of your word.

verses.ln1: I am as glad of your word
verses.ln2: as one who finds great spoils.

verses.ln1: As for lies, I hate and abhor them,
verses.ln2: but your law do I love.

verses.ln1: Seven times a day do I praise you,
verses.ln2: because of your righteous judgments.

verses.ln1: Great is the peace they have who love your law
verses.ln2: and find in it no stumbling block.

verses.ln1: Lord, I have looked for your saving health
verses.ln2: and have done your commandments.

verses.ln1: My soul has kept your testimonies,
verses.ln2: and I have loved them exceedingly.

verses.ln1: I have kept your commandments and testimonies,
verses.ln2: for all my ways are before you.

verses.ln1: Let my complaint come before you, O Lord;
verses.ln2: give me understanding, according to your word.

verses.ln1: Let my supplication come before you;
verses.ln2: deliver me, according to your word.

verses.ln1: My lips shall pour forth your praise,
verses.ln2: when you have taught me your statutes.

verses.ln1: Surely my tongue shall sing of your word,
verses.ln2: for all your commandments are righteous.

verses.ln1: Let your hand be strong to help me,
verses.ln2: for I have chosen your commandments.

verses.ln1: I have longed for your saving health, O Lord,
verses.ln2: and in your law is my delight.

verses.ln1: O let my soul live, and it shall praise you;
verses.ln2: and let your judgments help me.

verses.ln1: I have gone astray like a sheep that is lost;
verses.ln2: O seek your servant, for I do not forget your commandments.

verses.ln1: When I was in trouble I called upon the Lord,
verses.ln2: and he hearkened to my calling.

verses.ln1: Deliver my soul, O Lord, from lying lips
verses.ln2: and from a deceitful tongue.

verses.ln1:
What reward shall be given or done unto you, 
O false tongue?
verses.ln2: Even mighty and sharp arrows, with hot burning coals.

verses.ln1: Woe is me, that I am constrained to dwell in Meshech,
verses.ln2: and to have my habitation among the tents of Kedar.

verses.ln1: My soul has long dwelt among those
verses.ln2: who are enemies of peace.

verses.ln1: I labor for peace, but when I speak to them of it,
verses.ln2: they make themselves ready for battle.

verses.ln1: I will lift up my eyes unto the hills;
verses.ln2: from whence comes my help?

verses.ln1: My help comes from the Lord,
verses.ln2: who has made heaven and earth.

verses.ln1: He will not let your foot be moved,
verses.ln2: and he who keeps you will not sleep.

verses.ln1: Behold, he who keeps Israel
verses.ln2: shall neither slumber nor sleep.

verses.ln1: The Lord himself is your keeper;
verses.ln2: the Lord is your defense upon your right hand,

verses.ln1: So that the sun shall not burn you by day,
verses.ln2: neither the moon by night.

verses.ln1: The Lord shall preserve you from all evil;
verses.ln2: indeed, it is he who shall keep your soul.

verses.ln1: The Lord shall preserve your going out and your coming in,
verses.ln2: from this time forth for evermore.

verses.ln1: I was glad when they said unto me,
verses.ln2: “We will go into the house of the Lord.”

verses.ln1: Now our feet are standing
verses.ln2: within your gates, O Jerusalem.

verses.ln1: Jerusalem is built as a city
verses.ln2: that is at unity in itself.

verses.ln1: For there the tribes go up, even the tribes of the Lord,
verses.ln2: as was decreed for Israel, to give thanks unto the Name of the Lord.

verses.ln1: For there is the throne of judgment,
verses.ln2: even the throne of the house of David.

verses.ln1: O pray for the peace of Jerusalem;
verses.ln2: they shall prosper that love you.

verses.ln1: Peace be within your walls
verses.ln2: and plenteousness within your palaces.

verses.ln1: For my brethren and companions’ sakes,
verses.ln2: I will wish you prosperity.

verses.ln1: Indeed, because of the house of the Lord our God,
verses.ln2: I will seek to do you good.

verses.ln1: Unto you I lift up my eyes,
verses.ln2: you who are enthroned in the heavens.

verses.ln1: Behold, as the eyes of servants look to the hand of their masters,
verses.ln2: and as the eyes of a maiden to the hand of her mistress,

verses.ln1: Even so our eyes wait upon the Lord our God,
verses.ln2: until he show us his favor.

verses.ln1: Have mercy upon us, O Lord, have mercy upon us,
verses.ln2: for we have suffered more than enough contempt.

verses.ln1: Long has our soul suffered the scorn of the wealthy
verses.ln2: and the spitefulness of the proud.

verses.ln1: If the Lord himself had not been on our side, now may Israel say:
verses.ln2: if the Lord himself had not been on our side, when men rose up against us,

verses.ln1: Then would they have swallowed us up alive,
verses.ln2: when they were so wrathfully displeased with us;

verses.ln1: Then the waters would have drowned us, and the torrent gone over us;
verses.ln2: then the raging waters would have gone clean over us.

verses.ln1: But praised be the Lord,
verses.ln2: who has not given us over to be prey for their teeth.

verses.ln1: We escaped like a bird out of the snare of the fowler;
verses.ln2: the snare is broken, and we have been delivered.

verses.ln1: Our help is in the Name of the Lord,
verses.ln2: the maker of heaven and earth.

verses.ln1: Those who put their trust in the Lord shall be like Mount Zion,
verses.ln2: which cannot be moved, but stands fast for ever.

verses.ln1: The hills stand about Jerusalem
verses.ln2: even as the Lord stands round about his people, from this time forth for evermore.

verses.ln1: For the scepter of the ungodly shall not rest upon the land allotted to the righteous,
verses.ln2: lest the righteous put forth their hand to do wickedness.

verses.ln1: Do good, O Lord, unto those who are good,
verses.ln2: unto those who are good and true of heart.

verses.ln1: As for those who turn aside to their own wicked ways, the Lord shall lead them away with the evildoers;
verses.ln2: but peace shall be upon Israel.

verses.ln1: When the Lord overturned the captivity of Zion,
verses.ln2: then were we like those who dream.

verses.ln1: Then was our mouth filled with laughter
verses.ln2: and our tongue with shouts of joy.

verses.ln1: Then they said among the nations,
verses.ln2: “The Lord has done great things for them.”

verses.ln1: Indeed, the Lord has done great things for us already,
verses.ln2: whereof we rejoice.

verses.ln1: Overturn our captivity, O Lord,
verses.ln2: as when streams refresh the deserts of the south.

verses.ln1: Those who sow in tears
verses.ln2: shall reap with songs of joy.

verses.ln1: He who goes on his way weeping and bears good seed
verses.ln2: shall doubtless come again with joy, and bring his sheaves with him.

verses.ln1: Unless the Lord builds the house,
verses.ln2: their labor is in vain who build it.

verses.ln1: Unless the Lord keeps the city,
verses.ln2: the watchman keeps vigil in vain.

verses.ln1: It is in vain that you rise up early, and take rest so late, and eat the bread of toil,
verses.ln2: for he gives to his beloved sleep.

verses.ln1: Behold, children are a heritage from the Lord,
verses.ln2: and the fruit of the womb is a gift that comes from him.

verses.ln1: Like arrows in the hand of a warrior,
verses.ln2: so are the children of one’s youth.

verses.ln1: Happy is the man who has his quiver full of them;
verses.ln2: he shall not be ashamed when he speaks with his enemies in the gate.

verses.ln1: Blessed are all those who fear the Lord
verses.ln2: and walk in his ways.

verses.ln1: For you shall eat of the labors of your hands;
verses.ln2: it shall be well with you, and happy you shall be.

verses.ln1: Your wife shall be as a fruitful vine
verses.ln2: upon the walls of your house,

verses.ln1: Your children like the olive branches
verses.ln2: round about your table.

verses.ln1: Indeed, thus shall the man be blessed
verses.ln2: who fears the Lord.

verses.ln1: May the Lord bless you out of Zion;
verses.ln2: may you see Jerusalem in prosperity all your life long.

verses.ln1: May you see your children’s children,
verses.ln2: and may there be peace upon Israel.

verses.ln1: “Many a time have they fought against me from my youth on,”
verses.ln2: may Israel now say;

verses.ln1: “Indeed, many a time have they afflicted me from my youth on,  *
verses.ln2: but they have not prevailed against me.

verses.ln1: The plowers plowed upon my back,
verses.ln2: and made long furrows.

verses.ln1: But the righteous Lord
verses.ln2: has hewn the snares of the ungodly in pieces.”

verses.ln1: Let them be ashamed and turned backward,
verses.ln2: as many as hate Zion.

verses.ln1: Let them be as the grass growing upon the housetops,
verses.ln2: which withers before it grows up,

verses.ln1: Which does not fill the hand of the reaper,
verses.ln2: neither the bosom of him who binds up the sheaves,

verses.ln1: So that those who go by say not so much as, “The Lord prosper you.
verses.ln2: We bless you in the Name of the Lord.”

verses.ln1: Out of the deep have I called unto you, O Lord;
verses.ln2: Lord, hear my voice.

verses.ln1: O let your ears consider well
verses.ln2: the voice of my supplications.

verses.ln1: If you, Lord, were to mark what is done amiss,
verses.ln2: O Lord, who could abide it?

verses.ln1: For there is mercy with you;
verses.ln2: therefore you shall be feared.

verses.ln1: I wait for the Lord; my soul waits for him;
verses.ln2: in his word is my trust.

verses.ln1: My soul waits for the Lord,
verses.ln2: more than watchmen for the morning, more than watchmen for the morning.

verses.ln1: O Israel, trust in the Lord, for with the Lord there is mercy,
verses.ln2: and with him is plenteous redemption;

verses.ln1: And he shall redeem Israel
verses.ln2: from all their sins.

verses.ln1: O Lord, I am not haughty;
verses.ln2: I have no proud looks.

verses.ln1: I do not occupy myself with great matters,
verses.ln2: or with things that are too high for me.

verses.ln1: But I have stilled and quieted my soul, like a weaned child upon his mother’s breast;
verses.ln2: so is my soul quieted within me.

verses.ln1: O Israel, trust in the Lord
verses.ln2: from this time forth for evermore.

verses.ln1: Lord, remember David,
verses.ln2: and all his tribulations,

verses.ln1: How he swore unto the Lord,
verses.ln2: and vowed a vow unto the Almighty God of Jacob:

verses.ln1: “I will not come within the tabernacle of my house,
verses.ln2: nor climb up into my bed,

verses.ln1: I will not allow my eyes to sleep, nor my eyelids to slumber,
verses.ln2: neither the temples of my head to take any rest,

verses.ln1: Until I find a place for the temple of the Lord,
verses.ln2: a habitation for the mighty God of Jacob.”

verses.ln1: Lo, we heard of the ark at Ephrathah
verses.ln2: and found it in the wood.

verses.ln1: We will go into his tabernacle,
verses.ln2: and fall low on our knees before his footstool.

verses.ln1: Arise, O Lord, into your resting-place,
verses.ln2: you and the ark of your strength.

verses.ln1: Let your priests be clothed with righteousness,
verses.ln2: and let your saints sing with joy.

verses.ln1: For your servant David’s sake,
verses.ln2: turn not away the presence of your Anointed.

verses.ln1: The Lord has made a faithful oath unto David,
verses.ln2: and he shall not shrink from it:

verses.ln1: “Of the fruit of your body
verses.ln2: shall I set upon your throne.

verses.ln1: If your children will keep my covenant, and my testimonies that I shall teach them,
verses.ln2: their children also shall sit upon your throne for evermore.”

verses.ln1: For the Lord has chosen Zion for himself;
verses.ln2: he has longed for her to be his habitation:

verses.ln1: “This shall be my rest for ever;
verses.ln2: here will I dwell, for I have a delight therein.

verses.ln1: I will bless her provisions with increase,
verses.ln2: and will satisfy her poor with bread.

verses.ln1: I will clothe her priests with salvation,
verses.ln2: and her saints shall rejoice and sing.

verses.ln1: There shall I make the horn of David flourish;
verses.ln2: I have prepared a lantern for my Anointed.

verses.ln1: As for his enemies, I shall clothe them with shame;
verses.ln2: but upon his head shall his crown flourish.”

verses.ln1: Behold, how good and joyful a thing it is
verses.ln2: when brethren dwell together in unity.

verses.ln1: It is like the precious ointment upon the head, that ran down upon the beard,
verses.ln2: even Aaron’s beard, and went down to the edges of his clothing,

verses.ln1: Like the dew of Hermon,
verses.ln2: which falls upon the hills of Zion.

verses.ln1: For there the Lord promised his blessing,
verses.ln2: even life for evermore.

verses.ln1: Behold now, praise the Lord,
verses.ln2: all you servants of the Lord,

verses.ln1: You that stand by night in the house of the Lord,
verses.ln2: even in the courts of the house of our God.

verses.ln1: Lift up your hands in the sanctuary
verses.ln2: and sing praises unto the Lord.

verses.ln1: The Lord who made heaven and earth
verses.ln2: give you blessing out of Zion.

verses.ln1: O praise the Lord. Praise the Name of the Lord;
verses.ln2: offer praise, you servants of the Lord,

verses.ln1: You who stand in the house of the Lord,
verses.ln2: in the courts of the house of our God.

verses.ln1: O praise the Lord, for the Lord is good;
verses.ln2: sing praises unto his Name, for it is lovely.

verses.ln1: For the Lord has chosen Jacob for himself
verses.ln2: and Israel for his own possession.

verses.ln1: For I know that the Lord is great,
verses.ln2: and that our Lord is above all gods.

verses.ln1: Whatsoever the Lord pleases he does, in heaven and on earth,
verses.ln2: in the seas and in all the deep places.

verses.ln1: He brings forth clouds from the ends of the earth
verses.ln2: and sends forth lightning with the rain, bringing the wind out of his treasuries.

verses.ln1: It was he who struck down the firstborn of Egypt,
verses.ln2: both of man and beast.

verses.ln1: He sent signs and wonders into the midst of you, O land of Egypt,
verses.ln2: against Pharaoh and all his servants.

verses.ln1: He smote many nations,
verses.ln2: and slew mighty kings:

verses.ln1: Sihon king of the Amorites, and Og the king of Bashan,
verses.ln2: and all the kingdoms of Canaan.

verses.ln1: And he gave their land to be an inheritance,
verses.ln2: an inheritance for Israel his people.

verses.ln1: Your Name, O Lord, endures for ever;
verses.ln2: so does your renown, O Lord, from one generation to another.

verses.ln1: For the Lord will avenge his people
verses.ln2: and have compassion upon his servants.

verses.ln1: As for the idols of the nations, they are but silver and gold,
verses.ln2: the work of human hands.

verses.ln1: They have mouths, but they speak not;
verses.ln2: eyes have they, but they see not;

verses.ln1: They have ears, and yet they hear not,
verses.ln2: neither is there any breath in their mouths.

verses.ln1: Those who make them are like them,
verses.ln2: and so are all who put their trust in them.

verses.ln1: Praise the Lord, O house of Israel;
verses.ln2: praise the Lord, O house of Aaron.

verses.ln1: Praise the Lord, O house of Levi;
verses.ln2: you who fear the Lord, praise the Lord.

verses.ln1: Praised be the Lord from Zion,
verses.ln2: who dwells in Jerusalem. Praise the Lord.

verses.ln1: O give thanks unto the Lord, for he is gracious,
verses.ln2: for his mercy endures for ever.

verses.ln1: O give thanks unto the God of all gods,
verses.ln2: for his mercy endures for ever.

verses.ln1: O give thanks unto the Lord of all lords,
verses.ln2: for his mercy endures for ever.

verses.ln1: Who alone does great wonders,
verses.ln2: for his mercy endures for ever.

verses.ln1: Who by his excellent wisdom made the heavens,
verses.ln2: for his mercy endures for ever.

verses.ln1: Who laid out the earth above the waters,
verses.ln2: for his mercy endures for ever.

verses.ln1: Who made the great lights,
verses.ln2: for his mercy endures for ever;

verses.ln1: The sun to rule the day,
verses.ln2: for his mercy endures for ever;

verses.ln1: The moon and the stars to govern the night,
verses.ln2: for his mercy endures for ever.

verses.ln1: Who struck down the firstborn of Egypt,
verses.ln2: for his mercy endures for ever;

verses.ln1: And brought out Israel from among them,
verses.ln2: for his mercy endures for ever;

verses.ln1: With a mighty hand and an outstretched arm,
verses.ln2: for his mercy endures for ever.

verses.ln1: Who divided the Red Sea in two parts,
verses.ln2: for his mercy endures for ever;

verses.ln1: And made Israel to pass through the midst of it,
verses.ln2: for his mercy endures for ever;

verses.ln1: But as for Pharaoh and his host, he overthrew them in the Red Sea,
verses.ln2: for his mercy endures for ever.

verses.ln1: Who led his people through the wilderness,
verses.ln2: for his mercy endures for ever.

verses.ln1: Who smote great kings,
verses.ln2: for his mercy endures for ever;

verses.ln1: And slew mighty kings,
verses.ln2: for his mercy endures for ever;

verses.ln1: Sihon king of the Amorites,
verses.ln2: for his mercy endures for ever;

verses.ln1: And Og the king of Bashan,
verses.ln2: for his mercy endures for ever;

verses.ln1: And gave away their land for an inheritance,
verses.ln2: for his mercy endures for ever;

verses.ln1: Even for an inheritance for Israel his servant,
verses.ln2: for his mercy endures for ever.

verses.ln1: Who remembered us when we were in trouble,
verses.ln2: for his mercy endures for ever;

verses.ln1: And delivered us from our enemies,
verses.ln2: for his mercy endures for ever.

verses.ln1: Who gives food to all flesh,
verses.ln2: for his mercy endures for ever.

verses.ln1: O give thanks unto the God of heaven,
verses.ln2: for his mercy endures for ever.

verses.ln1: O give thanks unto the Lord of lords
verses.ln2: for his mercy endures for ever.

verses.ln1: By the waters of Babylon we sat down and wept,
verses.ln2: when we remembered you, O Zion.

verses.ln1: As for our harps, we hung them up
verses.ln2: upon the trees that are therein.

verses.ln1: For those who led us away captive required of us a song and melody in our heaviness:
verses.ln2: “Sing us one of the songs of Zion.”

verses.ln1: How shall we sing the Lord’s song
verses.ln2: in the land of our captivity?

verses.ln1: If I forget you, O Jerusalem,
verses.ln2: let my right hand forget its skill.

verses.ln1: If I do not remember you, let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth,
verses.ln2: if I prefer not Jerusalem above my dearest joy.

verses.ln1: Remember the children of Edom, O Lord, in the day of Jerusalem,
verses.ln2: how they said, “Down with it, down with it, even to the ground.”

verses.ln1: O daughter of Babylon, wasted with misery,
verses.ln2: happy shall be the one who rewards you as you have done to us.

verses.ln1: Blessed shall he be who takes your children
verses.ln2: and throws them against the stones.

verses.ln1: I will give thanks to you, O Lord, with my whole heart;
verses.ln2: even before the gods will I sing praises to you.

verses.ln1: I will worship toward your holy temple and praise your Name, because of your loving-kindness and truth,
verses.ln2: for you have magnified your Name and your word above all things.

verses.ln1: When I called upon you, you heard me
verses.ln2: and gave me increase of strength.

verses.ln1: All the kings of the earth shall praise you, O Lord,
verses.ln2: for they have heard the words of your mouth.

verses.ln1: They shall sing of the ways of the Lord,
verses.ln2: that great is the glory of the Lord.

verses.ln1: For though the Lord be high, yet he has respect for the lowly;*
verses.ln2: as for the proud, he beholds them from afar.

verses.ln1: Though I walk in the midst of trouble, yet shall you refresh me;
verses.ln2: you shall stretch forth your hand upon the furiousness of my enemies, and your right hand shall save me.

verses.ln1: The Lord shall make good his loving-kindness toward me;
verses.ln2: your mercy, O Lord, endures for ever; despise not the works of your own hands.

verses.ln1: O Lord, you have searched me out and known me;
verses.ln2: you know my sitting down and my rising up; you understand my thoughts from afar.

verses.ln1: You examine my path and my places of rest,
verses.ln2: and are acquainted with all my ways.

verses.ln1: Indeed, there is not a word on my tongue,
verses.ln2: but you, O Lord, know it altogether.

verses.ln1: You have enclosed me behind and before,
verses.ln2: and have laid your hand upon me.

verses.ln1: Such knowledge is too wonderful for me,
verses.ln2: so excellent I cannot attain to it.

verses.ln1: Where shall I go then from your Spirit,
verses.ln2: or where shall I flee from your presence?

verses.ln1: If I climb up to heaven, you are there;
verses.ln2: if I make my bed in the Grave, you are there also.

verses.ln1: If I take the wings of the morning
verses.ln2: and dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea,

verses.ln1: Even there shall your hand lead me,
verses.ln2: and your right hand shall hold me.

verses.ln1: If I say, “Surely the darkness shall cover me,”
verses.ln2: then shall my night be turned to day.

verses.ln1: Even the darkness is not dark to you, and the night is as clear as the day;
verses.ln2: the darkness and the light to you are both alike.

verses.ln1: For you yourself made my inmost parts;
verses.ln2: you knit me together in my mother’s womb.

verses.ln1: I will give thanks to you, for I am fearfully and wonderfully made;
verses.ln2: marvelous are your works, and my soul knows it very well.

verses.ln1: My bones were not hidden from you
verses.ln2: when I was made in secret and fashioned in the depths of the earth.

verses.ln1: Your eyes beheld my substance, while I was yet unformed;
verses.ln2: and in your book were all my members written,

verses.ln1: Which day by day were fashioned,
verses.ln2: when as yet there was none of them.

verses.ln1: How dear to me are your thoughts, O God.
verses.ln2: How great is the sum of them!

verses.ln1: If I were to count them, they would be more in number than the sand.
verses.ln2: When I wake up, I am present with you.

verses.ln1: Oh, that you would slay the wicked, O God!
verses.ln2: Depart from me, you bloodthirsty men.

verses.ln1: For they speak unrighteously against you;
verses.ln2: your enemies take your Name in vain.

verses.ln1: Do I not hate those, O Lord, who hate you,
verses.ln2: and do I not loathe those who rise up against you?

verses.ln1: Indeed, I hate them with a perfect hatred;
verses.ln2: they have become my own enemies.

verses.ln1: Search me, O God, and know my heart;
verses.ln2: try me and examine my thoughts.

verses.ln1: Look well if there be any way of wickedness in me,
verses.ln2: and lead me in the way everlasting.

verses.ln1: Deliver me, O Lord, from evildoers,
verses.ln2: and preserve me from the violent,

verses.ln1: Who imagine evil in their hearts
verses.ln2: and stir up strife all the day long.

verses.ln1: They have sharpened their tongues like a serpent;
verses.ln2: adders’ poison is under their lips.

verses.ln1: Keep me, O Lord, from the hands of the ungodly;
verses.ln2: preserve me from the violent, who have purposed to overthrow my steps.

verses.ln1: The proud have laid a snare for me and spread out a net with cords;
verses.ln2: they have set traps in my way.

verses.ln1: I said unto the Lord, “You are my God;
verses.ln2: hear the voice of my prayers, O Lord.”

verses.ln1: O Lord God, the strength of my salvation,
verses.ln2: you have covered my head in the day of battle.

verses.ln1: Let not the ungodly have their desire, O Lord;
verses.ln2: let not their evil imagination prosper, lest they be too proud.

verses.ln1: Let not those who encompass me lift up their heads;
verses.ln2: let the evil of their own lips consume them.

verses.ln1: Let hot burning coals fall upon them;
verses.ln2: let them be cast into the fire and into the pit, that they may never rise up again.

verses.ln1: A slanderer shall not prosper upon the earth;
verses.ln2: evil shall hunt the wicked person to overthrow him.

verses.ln1: I am sure that the Lord will avenge the poor
verses.ln2: and maintain the cause of the helpless.

verses.ln1: Surely, the righteous shall give thanks unto your Name,
verses.ln2: and the just shall continue in your sight.

verses.ln1: Lord, I call upon you; hasten unto me,
verses.ln2: and hear my voice when I cry unto you.

verses.ln1: Let my prayer be set forth in your sight as incense,
verses.ln2: and let the lifting up of my hands be an evening sacrifice.

verses.ln1: Set a watch, O Lord, before my mouth,
verses.ln2: and keep the door of my lips.

verses.ln1: O let not my heart be inclined to any evil thing;
verses.ln2: let me not be occupied in ungodly works with those who work wickedness, lest I eat of such things as please them.

verses.ln1: Rather, let the righteous smite me,
verses.ln2: and in their loving-kindness reprove me.

verses.ln1: But let not the oil of the unrighteous anoint my head;
verses.ln2: while I live, I will pray against their wickedness.

verses.ln1: Let their rulers be overthrown in stony places,
verses.ln2: that they may hear my words, for they are sweet.

verses.ln1: Let their bones lie scattered at the mouth of the grave,
verses.ln2: as when the ploughman scatters the earth in furrows.

verses.ln1: But my eyes look unto you, O Lord God;
verses.ln2: in you is my refuge; O do not cast out my soul.

verses.ln1: Keep me from the snare which they have laid for me,
verses.ln2: and from the traps of the evildoers.

verses.ln1: Let the ungodly fall into their own nets together,
verses.ln2: and let me ever escape them.

verses.ln1: I cried unto the Lord with my voice;
verses.ln2: even unto the Lord I made my supplication.

verses.ln1: I poured out my complaints before him,
verses.ln2: and showed him my trouble.

verses.ln1: When my spirit was in heaviness, you knew my path;
verses.ln2: in the way wherein I walked they had secretly laid a snare for me.

verses.ln1: I looked also to my right hand
verses.ln2: and saw there was no one who would know me.

verses.ln1: I had no place to flee to,
verses.ln2: and no one cared for my soul.

verses.ln1: I cried out to you, O Lord, and said,
verses.ln2: “You are my refuge, and my portion in the land of the living.”

verses.ln1: Consider my complaint,
verses.ln2: for I am brought very low.

verses.ln1: O deliver me from my persecutors,
verses.ln2: for they are too strong for me.

verses.ln1: Bring me out of prison, that I may give thanks unto your Name.
verses.ln2: When you show me your loving-kindness, then shall the righteous gather around me.

verses.ln1: Hear my prayer, O Lord, and consider my supplications;
verses.ln2: hearken to me, for your truth and righteousness’ sake.

verses.ln1: Enter not into judgment with your servant,
verses.ln2: for in your sight shall no one living be justified.

verses.ln1: For the enemy has persecuted my soul; he has smitten my life down to the ground;
verses.ln2: he has laid me in the darkness, like those who have been long dead.

verses.ln1: Therefore my spirit faints within me,
verses.ln2: and my heart within me is desolate.

verses.ln1: Yet I remember the time past; I muse upon all your works;
verses.ln2: indeed, I meditate on the works of your hands.

verses.ln1: I stretch forth my hands to you;
verses.ln2: my soul gasps for you as a thirsty land.

verses.ln1: Hear me, O Lord, and very soon, for my spirit grows faint;
verses.ln2: hide not your face from me, lest I be like those who go down into the pit.

verses.ln1: O let me hear your loving-kindness in the morning, for in you have I put my trust;
verses.ln2: show me the way that I should walk in, for I lift up my soul unto you.

verses.ln1: Deliver me, O Lord, from my enemies,
verses.ln2: for I flee unto you to hide me.

verses.ln1: Teach me to do the thing that pleases you, for you are my God;*
verses.ln2: let your loving Spirit lead me forth into the land of righteousness.

verses.ln1: Revive me, O Lord, for your Name’s sake;
verses.ln2: and for your righteousness’ sake bring my soul out of trouble.

verses.ln1: Of your goodness slay my enemies,
verses.ln2: and destroy all those who afflict my soul, for I am your servant.

verses.ln1: Blessed be the Lord my strength,
verses.ln2: who teaches my hands to war and my fingers to fight,

verses.ln1: My hope and my fortress, my stronghold and deliverer, my defender in whom I trust,
verses.ln2: who subdues the peoples under me.

verses.ln1: O Lord, what is man, that you have shown such respect to him,
verses.ln2: or the son of man, that you so regard him?

verses.ln1: Man is like a thing of nought;
verses.ln2: his time passes away like a shadow.

verses.ln1: Bow your heavens, O Lord, and come down;
verses.ln2: touch the mountains, and they shall smoke.

verses.ln1: Cast forth your lightning and scatter them;
verses.ln2: shoot out your arrows and consume them.

verses.ln1: Send down your hand from above;
verses.ln2: deliver me, and take me out of the great waters, from the hand of strangers,

verses.ln1: Whose mouth talks of vain things,
verses.ln2: and whose right hand is a right hand of falsehood.

verses.ln1: I will sing a new song unto you, O God,
verses.ln2: and sing praises unto you upon a ten-stringed lute.

verses.ln1: You have given victory to kings,
verses.ln2: and have delivered David your servant from the peril of the sword.

verses.ln1: Save me, and deliver me from the hand of strangers,
verses.ln2: whose mouth talks of vain things, and whose right hand is a right hand of falsehood;

verses.ln1: That our sons may grow up as young plants,
verses.ln2: and that our daughters may be as the polished corners of the temple,

verses.ln1: That our storehouses may be full and plenteous with all manner of grain,
verses.ln2: that our sheep may bring forth thousands and ten thousands in our fields,

verses.ln1: That our oxen may be strong to labor, that there be no decay,
verses.ln2: no leading into captivity, and no outcry in our streets.

verses.ln1: Happy are the people of whom this is so;
verses.ln2: indeed, blessed are the people who have the Lord for their God.

verses.ln1: I will magnify you, O God my King,
verses.ln2: and I will praise your Name for ever and ever.

verses.ln1: Every day will I give thanks to you,
verses.ln2: and praise your Name for ever and ever.

verses.ln1: Great is the Lord, and most worthy to be praised;
verses.ln2: there is no end of his greatness.

verses.ln1: One generation shall praise your works to another,
verses.ln2: and shall declare your power.

verses.ln1: As for me, I will be talking of the glorious splendor of your majesty,
verses.ln2: and of all your wondrous works.

verses.ln1: They shall speak of the might of your marvelous acts,
verses.ln2: and I also will tell of your greatness.

verses.ln1: The remembrance of your abundant goodness shall they proclaim,
verses.ln2: and they shall sing of your righteousness.

verses.ln1: The Lord is gracious and merciful,
verses.ln2: long-suffering, and of great kindness.

verses.ln1: The Lord is loving to everyone,
verses.ln2: and his mercy is over all his works.

verses.ln1: All your works praise you, O Lord,
verses.ln2: and your faithful servants give thanks to you.

verses.ln1: They speak of the glory of your kingdom
verses.ln2: and talk of your power,

verses.ln1: That your power may be known to the children of men,
verses.ln2: even the glorious splendor of your kingdom.

verses.ln1: Your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom,
verses.ln2: and your dominion endures throughout all ages.

verses.ln1: The Lord upholds all those who fall
verses.ln2: and lifts up all those who are bowed down.

verses.ln1: The eyes of all wait upon you, O Lord,
verses.ln2: and you give them their food in due season.

verses.ln1: You open wide your hand,
verses.ln2: and fill all things living with plenteousness.

verses.ln1: The Lord is righteous in all his ways
verses.ln2: and merciful in all his works.

verses.ln1: The Lord is near to all those who call upon him,
verses.ln2: to all who call upon him faithfully.

verses.ln1: He will fulfill the desire of those who fear him;
verses.ln2: he also will hear their cry and will help them.

verses.ln1: The Lord preserves all those who love him,
verses.ln2: but he will destroy all the ungodly.

verses.ln1: My mouth shall speak the praise of the Lord;
verses.ln2: and let all flesh give thanks unto his holy Name for ever and ever.

verses.ln1: Praise the Lord, O my soul;
verses.ln2: while I live I will praise the Lord.

verses.ln1: Indeed, as long as I have my being,
verses.ln2: I will sing praises unto my God.

verses.ln1: Put not your trust in princes, nor in any child of man,
verses.ln2: for there is no help in them.

verses.ln1: For when one breathes his last, he shall return again to the earth,
verses.ln2: and in that day all his thoughts perish.

verses.ln1: Blessed is the one who has the God of Jacob for his help
verses.ln2: and whose hope is in the Lord his God,

verses.ln1: Who made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that is therein;
verses.ln2: who keeps his promise for ever;

verses.ln1: Who does right to those who suffer wrong;
verses.ln2: and who feeds the hungry.

verses.ln1: The Lord sets prisoners free;
verses.ln2: the Lord gives sight to the blind.

verses.ln1: The Lord helps those who have fallen;
verses.ln2: the Lord loves the righteous.

verses.ln1: The Lord cares for the strangers in the land; he defends the fatherless and widow;
verses.ln2: but the way of the ungodly he makes crooked.

verses.ln1: The Lord shall be King for evermore,
verses.ln2:
even your God, O Zion, throughout all generations. 
Praise the Lord.

verses.ln1: Praise the Lord, for it is a good thing to sing praises unto our God;
verses.ln2: indeed, a joyful and pleasant thing it is to be thankful.

verses.ln1: The Lord builds up Jerusalem,
verses.ln2: and gathers together the outcasts of Israel.

verses.ln1: He heals those who are broken in heart,
verses.ln2: and binds up their wounds.

verses.ln1: He counts the number of the stars,
verses.ln2: and calls them all by their names.

verses.ln1: Great is our Lord, and great is his power;
verses.ln2: indeed, his wisdom is infinite.

verses.ln1: The Lord lifts up the meek,
verses.ln2: and brings the ungodly down to the ground.

verses.ln1: O sing unto the Lord with thanksgiving;
verses.ln2: sing praises with the harp unto our God,

verses.ln1: Who covers the heavens with clouds, and prepares rain for the earth,
verses.ln2: and makes the grass to grow upon the mountains, and plants for the use of men,

verses.ln1: Who gives food to the cattle
verses.ln2: and feeds the young ravens that call upon him.

verses.ln1: He has no pleasure in the strength of a horse;
verses.ln2: neither does he delight in any man’s strength.

verses.ln1: But the Lord’s delight is in those who fear him
verses.ln2: and put their trust in his mercy.

verses.ln1: Praise the Lord, O Jerusalem;
verses.ln2: praise your God, O Zion.

verses.ln1: For he has made strong the bars of your gates
verses.ln2: and has blessed your children within you.

verses.ln1: He makes peace in your borders
verses.ln2: and fills you with the finest of wheat.

verses.ln1: He sends forth his commandment upon the earth,
verses.ln2: and his word runs very swiftly.

verses.ln1: He gives snow like wool
verses.ln2: and scatters the white frost like ashes.

verses.ln1: He casts forth his ice like crumbs;
verses.ln2: who is able to abide his frost?

verses.ln1: He sends out his word and melts them;
verses.ln2: he blows with his wind, and the waters flow.

verses.ln1: He declares his word unto Jacob,
verses.ln2: his statutes and ordinances unto Israel.

verses.ln1: He has not dealt so with other nations;
verses.ln2: neither have they knowledge of his laws. Praise the Lord.

verses.ln1: Praise the Lord. O praise the Lord of heaven;
verses.ln2: praise him in the heights.

verses.ln1: Praise him, all you angels of his;
verses.ln2: praise him, all his host.

verses.ln1: Praise him, sun and moon;
verses.ln2: praise him, all you stars of light.

verses.ln1: Praise him, all you highest heavens,
verses.ln2: and you waters that are above the heavens.

verses.ln1: Let them praise the Name of the Lord,
verses.ln2: for he spoke the word, and they were made; he commanded, and they were created.

verses.ln1: He has made them stand fast for ever and ever;
verses.ln2: he has given them a law which shall not be broken.

verses.ln1: Praise the Lord upon earth,
verses.ln2: you sea monsters and all deeps;

verses.ln1: Fire and hail, snow and fog,
verses.ln2: wind and storm, fulfilling his word;

verses.ln1: Mountains and all hills,
verses.ln2: fruitful trees and all cedars;

verses.ln1: Beasts and all cattle,
verses.ln2: creeping things and birds of the air;

verses.ln1: Kings of the earth and all peoples,
verses.ln2: princes and all rulers of the world;

verses.ln1: Young men and maidens,
verses.ln2: old men and children together.

verses.ln1: Let them praise the Name of the Lord,
verses.ln2: for his Name only is excellent, and his praise above heaven and earth.

verses.ln1: He shall exalt the horn of his people; all his faithful shall praise him,
verses.ln2:
the children of Israel, the people who are near him. 
Praise the Lord.

verses.ln1: Praise the Lord. O sing unto the Lord a new song;
verses.ln2: let the congregation of the faithful praise him.

verses.ln1: Let Israel rejoice in the one who made him,
verses.ln2: and let the children of Zion be joyful in their King.

verses.ln1: Let them praise his Name in the dance;
verses.ln2: let them sing praises unto him with timbrel and harp.

verses.ln1: For the Lord has pleasure in his people
verses.ln2: and gives victory to those who are oppressed.

verses.ln1: Let the faithful be joyful with glory;
verses.ln2: let them rejoice upon their beds.

verses.ln1: Let the praises of God be in their mouth
verses.ln2: and a two-edged sword in their hands,

verses.ln1: To inflict vengeance on the nations,
verses.ln2: and to rebuke the peoples,

verses.ln1: To bind their kings in chains,
verses.ln2: and their nobles with links of iron,

verses.ln1: That they may execute judgment upon them, as it is written;
verses.ln2: this is the honor of all his servants. Praise the Lord.

verses.ln1: Praise the Lord. Praise God in his holiness;
verses.ln2: praise him in the firmament of his power.

verses.ln1: Praise him for his mighty acts;
verses.ln2: praise him for his excellent greatness.

verses.ln1: Praise him with the sound of the trumpet;
verses.ln2: praise him upon the lute and harp.

verses.ln1: Praise him with the timbrels and dances;
verses.ln2: praise him upon the strings and pipe.

verses.ln1: Praise him with the resounding cymbals;
verses.ln2: praise him with the loud cymbals.

verses.ln1: Let everything that has breath praise the Lord.
verses.ln2: O praise the Lord.

verses.ln1: The Lord is my shepherd;
verses.ln2: I shall not want.

verses.ln1: He maketh me to lie down in green pastures:
verses.ln2: he leadeth me beside the still waters.

verses.ln1: He restoreth my soul:
verses.ln2: he leadeth me in the paths of righteousness for his Name’s sake.

verses.ln1: Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil:
verses.ln2: for thou art with me; thy rod and thy staff they comfort me.

verses.ln1: Thou preparest a table before me in the presence of mine enemies:
verses.ln2: thou anointest my head with oil; my cup runneth over.

verses.ln1: Surely goodness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life:
verses.ln2: and I will dwell in the house of the Lord for ever.
